revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-01-24 07:00:45.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/common/rest_client.py'], 'message': 'Output a response body when fails to parse it

Nova returns a 500 error response with XML format, Tempest cannot
parse the body now.

This patch adds a log for outputting the body as the first step.
After getting a log, we will fix XML deserializer.

Change-Id: I8589e1c6e822a7d3a8f1a0bcee888267bf0529cc
'}]
commit_message:
Output a response body when fails to parse it

Nova returns a 500 error response with XML format, Tempest cannot
parse the body now.

This patch adds a log for outputting the body as the first step.
After getting a log, we will fix XML deserializer.

Change-Id: I8589e1c6e822a7d3a8f1a0bcee888267bf0529cc

subject: Use service catalog to get glance client for nova
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-01-24 07:30:06.000000000', 'files': ['nova/image/glance.py'], 'message': "Use service catalog to get glance client for nova

Now nova get glance client according to the configuration
'glance_api_servers' in nova.conf. If we didn't configure
glance host or glance_api_servers, nova may not get the
right glance client.

This commit allows nova to create glance client without
endpoint, then glance client will get the endpoint url
by service catalog.

Change-Id: Iae9c3d6462629030d88cc085f3de255080637948
Closes-Bug: #1220131
"}]
commit_message:
Use service catalog to get glance client for nova

Now nova get glance client according to the configuration
'glance_api_servers' in nova.conf. If we didn't configure
glance host or glance_api_servers, nova may not get the
right glance client.

This commit allows nova to create glance client without
endpoint, then glance client will get the endpoint url
by service catalog.

Change-Id: Iae9c3d6462629030d88cc085f3de255080637948
Closes-Bug: #1220131

commit_message:
Added missing accept_transfer to FC

The base class FibreChannelDriver was
missing the new accept_transfer method.
This was caught while running the devstack
driver certification tests again the
3PAR FC driver.
This patch adds the missing method to the
base VolumeDriver.

Change-Id: I0aa91a4f11edd03eee7607d15317b89c30732cb7
Closes-Bug: #1269633

revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2014-01-22 18:25:08.000000000', 'files': ['heat/engine/parameters.py', 'heat/engine/properties.py', 'heat/engine/constraints.py'], 'message': 'Enable better sub-classing of common Schema class

This patch is first in a series of patches to unify the code for
property and parameter validation based on a common Schema class.

The current patch refactors the existing Schema class in
constraints.py so it will in a subsequent patch be easier to
sub-class it, i.e. to rebase the parameters schema class on it.

For example, sub-classes will be able to override uppercase/
lowercase spelling of data type names etc., which will save us
translation between CFN and HOT specifics in the engine.

Change-Id: I0418a00f045af590b17500716a74b8cc6ff72409
Partial-Bug: #1230229
Implements: blueprint schema-code-consolidation
'}]
commit_message:
Enable better sub-classing of common Schema class

This patch is first in a series of patches to unify the code for
property and parameter validation based on a common Schema class.

The current patch refactors the existing Schema class in
constraints.py so it will in a subsequent patch be easier to
sub-class it, i.e. to rebase the parameters schema class on it.

For example, sub-classes will be able to override uppercase/
lowercase spelling of data type names etc., which will save us
translation between CFN and HOT specifics in the engine.

Change-Id: I0418a00f045af590b17500716a74b8cc6ff72409
Partial-Bug: #1230229
Implements: blueprint schema-code-consolidation

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2014-01-22 11:25:41.000000000', 'files': ['glanceclient/shell.py', 'glanceclient/v1/client.py', 'glanceclient/v2/client.py', 'tests/v2/test_client.py', 'glanceclient/common/utils.py', 'tests/v1/test_client.py'], 'message': "Handle endpoints with versions consistently

When using the cli the Glance client wraps the endpoint in a 'strip
version' function. This means that endpoints of the following forms can
both be used:

https://region-x.images.example.com:443/v1
https://region-x.images.example.com:443

When calling the client library directly (as Ceilometer does) however
only endpoints of the second form work. The cli and library should handle
the two cases consistently.

Addresses bug 1243276.

Change-Id: Ice7b581fee32540a7057ba47433a10166a3caed2
"}]
commit_message:
Handle endpoints with versions consistently

When using the cli the Glance client wraps the endpoint in a 'strip
version' function. This means that endpoints of the following forms can
both be used:

https://region-x.images.example.com:443/v1
https://region-x.images.example.com:443

When calling the client library directly (as Ceilometer does) however
only endpoints of the second form work. The cli and library should handle
the two cases consistently.

Addresses bug 1243276.

Change-Id: Ice7b581fee32540a7057ba47433a10166a3caed2

commit_message:
Replace basestring by six.string_types

Method shell._boot uses class basestring instead of six.string_types.
Tests don't check this method with several hints, so we didn't have
NameError in py33 env.

Change-Id: I9b35cd7ba162140a15929f9fc8a6d21755b3570c

commit_message:
Adding the ability to modify cluster templates

- Extended api for updating cluster templates
- Modified code duplication
- Added unit-tests

Implements: blueprint modifying-cluster-template

subject: Split AvailabilityZoneFilter to two filters
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-01-12 10:06:46.000000000', 'files': ['nova/scheduler/filters/availability_zone_filter.py', 'nova/tests/scheduler/test_host_filters.py', 'nova/scheduler/filters/availability_zone_aggregate_filter.py', 'doc/source/devref/filter_scheduler.rst'], 'message': 'Split AvailabilityZoneFilter to two filters

In Oslo, AvailabilityZoneFilter only handles availability_zone from
request_spec. In Nova, AvailabilityZoneFilter can handle
availability_zone from both request_spec and aggregation metadata,
we cannot sync AvailabilityZoneFilterfrom oslo to Nova when using
entry point for scheduler filters.

This patch splits the AvailabilityZoneFilter in Nova to two filters,
one is AvailabilityZoneFilter which has same logic with Oslo, the
other is named as AvailabilityZoneAggregateFilter which will only
handle availability_zone from aggregation metadata, this can make
sure Nova can sync AvailabilityZoneFilter from oslo and make
AvailabilityZoneFilter a common scheduler filter for both Nova and
Cinder.

DocImpact
AvailabilityZoneAggregateFilter: filters hosts by availability zone
in host aggregate metadata. It passes hosts matching the
availability zone specified in the aggregate metadata.

Implements part of bp nova-oslo-scheduler
Change-Id: Id2da655984339fd86eea320d743682112196030d
'}]
commit_message:
Split AvailabilityZoneFilter to two filters

In Oslo, AvailabilityZoneFilter only handles availability_zone from
request_spec. In Nova, AvailabilityZoneFilter can handle
availability_zone from both request_spec and aggregation metadata,
we cannot sync AvailabilityZoneFilterfrom oslo to Nova when using
entry point for scheduler filters.

This patch splits the AvailabilityZoneFilter in Nova to two filters,
one is AvailabilityZoneFilter which has same logic with Oslo, the
other is named as AvailabilityZoneAggregateFilter which will only
handle availability_zone from aggregation metadata, this can make
sure Nova can sync AvailabilityZoneFilter from oslo and make
AvailabilityZoneFilter a common scheduler filter for both Nova and
Cinder.

DocImpact
AvailabilityZoneAggregateFilter: filters hosts by availability zone
in host aggregate metadata. It passes hosts matching the
availability zone specified in the aggregate metadata.

Implements part of bp nova-oslo-scheduler
Change-Id: Id2da655984339fd86eea320d743682112196030d

commit_message:
notify: add schema validation system

This adds a schema validation system based on Colander. It loads the
schema based on entry points in the oslo.messaging.notify.schemas
namespace.
Once found this schema is used to validate the data passed in before
sending them.

Blueprint: notification-structured

subject: XenAPI: Fix translation of metadetails in aggregates
revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2013-12-23 10:36:09.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/xenapi/driver.py', 'nova/tests/virt/xenapi/test_xenapi.py', 'nova/virt/xenapi/vmops.py', 'nova/virt/xenapi/host.py', 'nova/virt/xenapi/pool.py'], 'message': 'XenAPI: Fix translation of metadetails in aggregates

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/43157/ added a translation from
the sqlalchemy model to the instance object replacing metadetails
with metadata.

This introduced more stack traces in general for XenAPI (when the
driver queried whether aggregates were in use) and actually broke
the host aggregate functionality

This change is an alternative to backporting the object support at
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/50466/ - which is a much more
substantial change

Fixes-bug: 1232179
Change-Id: I86c4d9257894d8163575f28cec400c69939b33b5
'}]
commit_message:
XenAPI: Fix translation of metadetails in aggregates

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/43157/ added a translation from
the sqlalchemy model to the instance object replacing metadetails
with metadata.

This introduced more stack traces in general for XenAPI (when the
driver queried whether aggregates were in use) and actually broke
the host aggregate functionality

This change is an alternative to backporting the object support at
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/50466/ - which is a much more
substantial change

Fixes-bug: 1232179
Change-Id: I86c4d9257894d8163575f28cec400c69939b33b5

subject: Whitelist external netifaces requirement
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-01-06 03:42:30.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': "Whitelist external netifaces requirement

* tox.ini(testenv.install_command): Use the --allow-external and
--allow-insecure options so that pip 1.5 and later will assent to
retrieve the netifaces package even though it's not hosted on PyPI.
The --allow-insecure option is aliased to a clearer
--allow-unverified wording in 1.5, but the old form is being used to
avoid breaking users of 1.4.x and will be valid at least through
1.6.x according to comments in the pip source.

Change-Id: I587b516f3f77c930475ca2eaae5ff73c5d2ab576
"}]
commit_message:
Whitelist external netifaces requirement

* tox.ini(testenv.install_command): Use the --allow-external and
--allow-insecure options so that pip 1.5 and later will assent to
retrieve the netifaces package even though it's not hosted on PyPI.
The --allow-insecure option is aliased to a clearer
--allow-unverified wording in 1.5, but the old form is being used to
avoid breaking users of 1.4.x and will be valid at least through
1.6.x according to comments in the pip source.

Change-Id: I587b516f3f77c930475ca2eaae5ff73c5d2ab576

subject: Have tox install via setup.py develop
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-12-15 01:03:59.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'Have tox install via setup.py develop

tox 1.6 was released, which means that we can now take advantage of
the feature we added to it - which is using setup.py develop to
install the code into the virtualenv. The logic was taken from
run_tests.sh - so the performance issues around using tox vs. using
install_venv should now be gone.

Additionally, override the tox pip install command to avoid using
the "--pre" option which is the default in tox. "--pre" means
"Include pre-release and development versions." By default, pip will
only install stable versions of software, and that is the behavior
we want.

Change-Id: Ida5e440d1bdb9f8e9031277ea53a02d2ef171438
Co-Authored-By: Monty Taylor <mordred@inaugust.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Have tox install via setup.py develop

tox 1.6 was released, which means that we can now take advantage of
the feature we added to it - which is using setup.py develop to
install the code into the virtualenv. The logic was taken from
run_tests.sh - so the performance issues around using tox vs. using
install_venv should now be gone.

Additionally, override the tox pip install command to avoid using
the "--pre" option which is the default in tox. "--pre" means
"Include pre-release and development versions." By default, pip will
only install stable versions of software, and that is the behavior
we want.

Change-Id: Ida5e440d1bdb9f8e9031277ea53a02d2ef171438
Co-Authored-By: Monty Taylor <mordred@inaugust.com>

commit_message:
Whitelist external netifaces requirement

* tox.ini(testenv.install_command): Use the --allow-external and
--allow-insecure options so that pip 1.5 and later will assent to
retrieve the netifaces package even though it's not hosted on PyPI.
The --allow-insecure option is aliased to a clearer
--allow-unverified wording in 1.5, but the old form is being used to
avoid breaking users of 1.4.x and will be valid at least through
1.6.x according to comments in the pip source.

Change-Id: I587b516f3f77c930475ca2eaae5ff73c5d2ab576

list of rhn channels or repos to enable. Default subscription method

commit_message:
Updated rhel element to support rhn

Added support for Red Hat Network (RHN) subscription. Extended to accept
list of rhn channels or repos to enable. Default subscription method
remains rhsm for backward compatibility. Also updated the default RHEL
image to the latest RHEL 6.5 image available on the Customer Portal.

Change-Id: Ia7f39bee7ae24253fa2002b3dc5b2293be3ff0bd

commit_message:
Simplify code in l2network_db_v2 by using defaultdict.

Code in l2network_db_v2.py was using an unnecessary conditional that
checked for a certain state.physical_network key in the allocations
dict. Using collections.defaultdict(set) removes this unnecessary
conditional and makes the code simpler to read.

Change-Id: I33306e8271a2613e67893894902fca588f66ecb2

Set the keystone API version in the auth_uri

Set the keystone API version in the auth_uri config option for Ironic,
if the URI contains no version Ironic won't be able to get the service

Closes-Bug: #1269894

commit_message:
volume.filters(rootwrap) should not use full paths

volume.filters for rootwrap uses full paths for the
binaries, which causes a problem if the binary has
a different path. It is not needed as the rootwrap
infrastructure allows the binaries to be in all
paths specified by exec_dirs.

Change-Id: I3e2383f1025a9a08b7dd33f48da156c6d8c3cd71
Closes-Bug: #1269894

commit_message:
Add a new xml namespace XMLNS_V3 for v3 API

This patch adds a new xml namespace for v3 API. The XMLNS_V11 is
also used in v3. It makes sense to add a new XMLNS_V3 for v3 API.

subject: Improve and unit-test template contents fetching
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-01-12 21:33:42.000000000', 'files': ['heatclient/tests/test_shell.py', 'heatclient/tests/test_template_utils.py', 'heatclient/common/template_utils.py', 'heatclient/v1/shell.py'], 'message': "Improve and unit-test template contents fetching

This includes some important changes in the way template
content is fetched:
* for template_file, the value is converted to a file:// URL and the
  actual fetching is performed with the URL fetching code path.
  As a consequence it is now possible to specify a file path *or*
  a URL for the --template-file command option. This is a change in
  behaviour, and it does make --template-url somewhat redundant.
  This makes the behaviour of --template-file consistent with the
  behaviour of --environment-file.
* for template_url, the content is fetched in heatclient so that
  the server does not need to fetch the template at all. This means
  that in the API request the 'template' field is populated instead
  of 'template_url'. We can consider deprecating 'template_url' from
  the REST API.

Change-Id: Id8de05973381dba7ac052c45dd074071fd3035b2
"}]
commit_message:
Improve and unit-test template contents fetching

This includes some important changes in the way template
content is fetched:
* for template_file, the value is converted to a file:// URL and the
  actual fetching is performed with the URL fetching code path.
  As a consequence it is now possible to specify a file path *or*
  a URL for the --template-file command option. This is a change in
  behaviour, and it does make --template-url somewhat redundant.
  This makes the behaviour of --template-file consistent with the
  behaviour of --environment-file.
* for template_url, the content is fetched in heatclient so that
  the server does not need to fetch the template at all. This means
  that in the API request the 'template' field is populated instead
  of 'template_url'. We can consider deprecating 'template_url' from
  the REST API.

Change-Id: Id8de05973381dba7ac052c45dd074071fd3035b2

commit_message:
Adding image location selection strategies

An image can be saved to more than one backend storage by multi-location
mechanism, Glance should have a capability to select the best backend
storage for improving image consuming performance. This change
implements two strategy modules: "location_order" and "store_type", and
allow Admin configure some strategy-specified options for Glance as
their deployment required.

As an end user, he can get VM or consuming image faster base on this
enhancement. This is not only for 'download' transport handling on the
API server side but also for client since they can obtain locations by
standard 'direct URL' interface.

docImpact
Implements bp: image-location-selection-strategy

Change-Id: I86f192aeae8e5f21a72f946552f6507654c25a6c
Signed-off-by: Zhi Yan Liu <zhiyanl@cn.ibm.com>

revisions:
[{'number': 13, 'created': '2014-01-22 02:05:50.000000000', 'files': ['glance/api/v2/image_data.py', 'glance/store/__init__.py', 'glance/tests/functional/v2/test_images.py', 'glance/common/exception.py', 'glance/tests/unit/test_cache_middleware.py', 'glance/domain/__init__.py', 'glance/tests/unit/v2/test_image_data_resource.py', 'glance/tests/unit/test_domain.py', 'glance/tests/unit/test_store_image.py'], 'message': 'Restore image status on duplicate image upload

Glance should not allow already uploaded images to be modified by
another upload. Currently, when configured with the local filesystem
backend, Glance prevents duplicate upload of an already uploaded image
BUT it changes the image status to "saving".

This commit adds a status transition state machine to the domain.Image
class and modifies the domain.Image.status setter function to verify
status transitions based on this state machine - only target states that
can be reached from the image's current state are permitted.

Tests have also been agumented to verify that the original image (meta)
data does not change in case of a conflicting upload.

Closes-Bug: #1241379

Change-Id: I62c5acae4c29abf0691d8279b51c59008f9c0047
'}]
commit_message:
Restore image status on duplicate image upload

Glance should not allow already uploaded images to be modified by
another upload. Currently, when configured with the local filesystem
backend, Glance prevents duplicate upload of an already uploaded image
BUT it changes the image status to "saving".

This commit adds a status transition state machine to the domain.Image
class and modifies the domain.Image.status setter function to verify
status transitions based on this state machine - only target states that
can be reached from the image's current state are permitted.

Tests have also been agumented to verify that the original image (meta)
data does not change in case of a conflicting upload.

Closes-Bug: #1241379

Change-Id: I62c5acae4c29abf0691d8279b51c59008f9c0047

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-01-22 19:50:10.000000000', 'files': ['spec/server-opensuse_spec.rb', 'spec/server_spec.rb', 'recipes/server.rb'], 'message': 'keystone-manage to be run by keystone user/group

keystone-manage pki_setup and keystone-manage db_sync should be run by
the designated keystone user and group. The reason being that these
commands when run as root (as is the case with chef) may drop a
keystone.log file. If this is the first pass, that file will be owned
by root and subsequent writes to that file by the proper keystone user
or group will likely fail.

This change also removes a redundant test for opensuse.

Change-Id: I627674b319738f9c79ff146ddfdf979db55b2c14
'}]
commit_message:
keystone-manage to be run by keystone user/group

keystone-manage pki_setup and keystone-manage db_sync should be run by
the designated keystone user and group. The reason being that these
commands when run as root (as is the case with chef) may drop a
keystone.log file. If this is the first pass, that file will be owned
by root and subsequent writes to that file by the proper keystone user
or group will likely fail.

This change also removes a redundant test for opensuse.

Change-Id: I627674b319738f9c79ff146ddfdf979db55b2c14

revisions:
[{'number': 13, 'created': '2014-01-17 03:26:54.000000000', 'files': ['ceilometer/tests/resourceloader/test_loader.py', 'ceilometer/resourceloader/file.py', 'ceilometer/resourceloader/__init__.py', 'ceilometer/central/manager.py', 'setup.cfg', 'ceilometer/tests/resourceloader/test_file.py', 'ceilometer/tests/resourceloader/__init__.py'], 'message': "Add resource loader support

Added the resource loader interface and base classes, also the
FileResourceLoader implementation to load the resources from a YAML
file.

The new method ceilometer.resourceloader.get_resources() can find the
appropriate resource loader and use that loader to load the resources to
return.

e.g: Suppose we have a YAML file /foo/bar with the following content:

- snmp://1.1.1.1
- snmp://2.2.2.2

and for the foloowing pipeline resource definition:

resources:
    - fileloader:///foo/bar
    - ipmi://1.2.3.4

The get_resources() will use the FileResourceLoader to load the
resources from the file /foo/bar. For the other resource
'ipmi://1.2.3.4', because no mapping resource loader can be found,
it will assume it's the actual resource to be return. So the returned
list of get_resources() is: ['snmp://1.1.1.1', 'snmp://2.2.2.2',
'ipmi://1.2.3.4'].

Implements: blueprint support-resources-pipeline-item
Change-Id: I438ecabdcfae0a03fa89d150d31dc9fbb3aeda1f
"}]
commit_message:
Add resource loader support

Added the resource loader interface and base classes, also the
FileResourceLoader implementation to load the resources from a YAML
file.

The new method ceilometer.resourceloader.get_resources() can find the
appropriate resource loader and use that loader to load the resources to
return.

e.g: Suppose we have a YAML file /foo/bar with the following content:

- snmp://1.1.1.1
- snmp://2.2.2.2

and for the foloowing pipeline resource definition:

resources:
    - fileloader:///foo/bar
    - ipmi://1.2.3.4

The get_resources() will use the FileResourceLoader to load the
resources from the file /foo/bar. For the other resource
'ipmi://1.2.3.4', because no mapping resource loader can be found,
it will assume it's the actual resource to be return. So the returned
list of get_resources() is: ['snmp://1.1.1.1', 'snmp://2.2.2.2',
'ipmi://1.2.3.4'].

Implements: blueprint support-resources-pipeline-item
Change-Id: I438ecabdcfae0a03fa89d150d31dc9fbb3aeda1f

subject: Merge db.sqlalchemy from oslo-incubator af5f710
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-01-09 16:08:55.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/openstack/common/db/sqlalchemy/__init__.py', 'keystone/openstack/common/db/__init__.py', 'keystone/openstack/common/db/sqlalchemy/migration.py', 'keystone/openstack/common/db/sqlalchemy/session.py'], 'message': "Merge db.sqlalchemy from oslo-incubator af5f710

The db.sqlalchemy module was not recent with oslo-incubator.

 $ git checkout af5f71096c7bb83fe2f956588a9ec643b0d9a2f6
 $ python update.py --nodeps --base keystone \
   --dest-dir ../keystone --modules db.sqlalchemy

The af5f710 oslo-incubator db.sqlalchemy contains a fix for the
following problem, which caused a regression in Keystone:

The database connection string was not marked as secret, so it
would be printed out in cleartext in the logs when config settings
were logged.

The database connection string typically contains the password
that's used to connect to the database, so it should be marked as
secret so that it doesn't get logged.

Change-Id: Ibdc63480a836646c5571a368f3c3a1d0c82d6aba
Closes-Bug: #1266590
"}]
commit_message:
Merge db.sqlalchemy from oslo-incubator af5f710

The db.sqlalchemy module was not recent with oslo-incubator.

 $ git checkout af5f71096c7bb83fe2f956588a9ec643b0d9a2f6
 $ python update.py --nodeps --base keystone \
   --dest-dir ../keystone --modules db.sqlalchemy

The af5f710 oslo-incubator db.sqlalchemy contains a fix for the
following problem, which caused a regression in Keystone:

The database connection string was not marked as secret, so it
would be printed out in cleartext in the logs when config settings
were logged.

The database connection string typically contains the password
that's used to connect to the database, so it should be marked as
secret so that it doesn't get logged.

Change-Id: Ibdc63480a836646c5571a368f3c3a1d0c82d6aba
Closes-Bug: #1266590

commit_message:
Implement notifications for trusts

Use the existing notifications wrapper to send notifications when a
trust is created or deleted. There is no need to send a notification on
a trust update since trusts are immutable. This change adds
trusts to the event_notifications.rst documentation.

Change-Id: I777ad4594ce9b93c36af675ac677cfa61524a3e7
blueprint: trust-notifications

commit_message:
Remove kwargs from trust_api.create_trust

This change allows notifications to be sent using the existing
implementation and the resulting trust ID is stored in args[1], instead
of kwargs. Using args this way maintains consistency with
trust_api.delete_trust().

Change-Id: I8169b9ea6fabcd8aff864c3bf900ceb1b32676f3
Closes-Bug: #1269157

commit_message:
Nova Docker driver must remove network namespace

The docker hypervisor creates for each container a network
namespace which represents the nova network. This network
namespace must be removed/destroyed when nova instance will
be destroyed in order to cleanup the machine properly.

Change-Id: I6fa306d06fb16f8ceddb06e22566974237082759
Closes-Bug: 1261007

When there is an error in the compute manager relating to
live-migrate, this change ensures that an instance fault is
recorded to help debug any issues.

We also need to look at better reporting of errors to users,
but this is not in the scope of this small change.

Change-Id: Ib4f0d0aea64468a4a1495b0318fc531a7d0d4eaa
'}]
commit_message:
Add instance faults during live_migrate errors

When there is an error in the compute manager relating to
live-migrate, this change ensures that an instance fault is
recorded to help debug any issues.

We also need to look at better reporting of errors to users,
but this is not in the scope of this small change.

Change-Id: Ib4f0d0aea64468a4a1495b0318fc531a7d0d4eaa

Add mapping function to keystone

relationships between identity providers and keystone

[{'number': 4, 'created': '2014-01-21 19:30:22.000000000', 'files': ['ceilometer/alarm/evaluator/utils.py', 'ceilometer/tests/alarm/evaluator/test_threshold.py', 'ceilometer/api/controllers/v2.py', 'ceilometer/tests/api/v2/test_alarm_scenarios.py', 'ceilometer/alarm/evaluator/threshold.py'], 'message': "Exclude weak datapoints from alarm threshold evaluation

Addresses: BP exclude-low-sample-count

To avoid alarm threshold evaluation being inappropriately skewed by
aggregates with anomalously low sample count, these weak data may be
excluded for selected alarms by setting a new 'exclude_outliers'
field on the alarm threshold rule.

An outlier in this context is considered to be an aggregate with

Change-Id: I45d05db57662588df5796a8d6864ed01d1e4165f
"}]
commit_message:
Exclude weak datapoints from alarm threshold evaluation

Addresses: BP exclude-low-sample-count

To avoid alarm threshold evaluation being inappropriately skewed by
aggregates with anomalously low sample count, these weak data may be
excluded for selected alarms by setting a new 'exclude_outliers'
field on the alarm threshold rule.

An outlier in this context is considered to be an aggregate with
sample count that differs from the observed mean by more than two
standard deviations.

Change-Id: I45d05db57662588df5796a8d6864ed01d1e4165f

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2013-12-06 19:50:05.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/token/backends/sql.py', 'keystone/tests/test_sql_upgrade.py', 'keystone/common/sql/migrate_repo/versions/036_token_drop_valid_index.py'], 'message': 'Remove unused token.valid index

Because valid is only ever used in conjunction with expires, we do not
need it to have its own index now that there is a covering compound
index for expires and valid.

Note that he expires index is still useful alone for purging old tokens
as we do not filter for valid in that case.

Change-Id: Ib8ac2ab740b480f8ab29c07e66247f4fce15150b
'}]
commit_message:
Remove unused token.valid index

Because valid is only ever used in conjunction with expires, we do not
need it to have its own index now that there is a covering compound
index for expires and valid.

Note that he expires index is still useful alone for purging old tokens
as we do not filter for valid in that case.

Change-Id: Ib8ac2ab740b480f8ab29c07e66247f4fce15150b

commit_message:
Set the SQL Float precision

By default mysql use a precision of 23 to store a Float and
sqlite/postgresql use 53.

The patch set the precision of Float to 53 to force all sql backends to
use the same double precision.

Change-Id: I36680ed180999e401e45428af068fd32126247da

commit_message:
add the validation of MaxSize ,MinSize and DesiredCapacity

* check whether MinSize is less than MaxSize
* check whether MinSize and MaxSize is not less than 0
* if DesiredCapacity is offered,check whether it is between
  MinSize and MaxSize

Change-Id: I79a7b6c0e61f109ac7e71d3fd48d93fb741bbc64
Closes-Bug: #1270070

subject: Always specify preserve_ephemeral on server rebuild
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-01-22 01:06:15.000000000', 'files': ['heat/engine/resources/nova_utils.py', 'heat/tests/test_server.py'], 'message': 'Always specify preserve_ephemeral on server rebuild

Heat unit tests currently fail with git master novaclient. Without
this change all heat gating will fail as soon as novaclient 2.16.0 is
released.

Ideally the test mox should handle preserve_ephemeral being specified or not
but it is not obvious that this is possible. Novaclient rebuild has a kwargs
so always specifying preserve_ephemeral should not have any issues with
older novaclient.

Change-Id: Ieba9d19fefa77faf91b1d55bfbaa6797aeaa1fee
Closes-Bug: #1271367
'}]
commit_message:
Always specify preserve_ephemeral on server rebuild

Heat unit tests currently fail with git master novaclient. Without
this change all heat gating will fail as soon as novaclient 2.16.0 is
released.

Ideally the test mox should handle preserve_ephemeral being specified or not
but it is not obvious that this is possible. Novaclient rebuild has a kwargs
so always specifying preserve_ephemeral should not have any issues with
older novaclient.

Change-Id: Ieba9d19fefa77faf91b1d55bfbaa6797aeaa1fee
Closes-Bug: #1271367

subject: Make test_poll_volume_usage_with_data more reliable
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-01-23 21:06:53.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/compute/test_compute.py'], 'message': "Make test_poll_volume_usage_with_data more reliable

This test includes 2 calls to time.time().  It assumes that the result
from the second call may be greater than the first.  This isn't
definietly true and we see periodic failures of this test in the gate as
a result.

Change the test to not worry about the specific time value that gets
set.  We set _last_vol_usage_poll to 0 before calling the function under
test.  We really only need to check that it got set to some value after
calling the function under test.  This tweak should make the test pass
consistently.

Change-Id: I6c01d2958cf671c29622562689a15ca1ddea0a3c
Closes-bug: #1270693
"}]
commit_message:
Make test_poll_volume_usage_with_data more reliable

This test includes 2 calls to time.time().  It assumes that the result
from the second call may be greater than the first.  This isn't
definietly true and we see periodic failures of this test in the gate as
a result.

Change the test to not worry about the specific time value that gets
set.  We set _last_vol_usage_poll to 0 before calling the function under
test.  We really only need to check that it got set to some value after
calling the function under test.  This tweak should make the test pass
consistently.

Change-Id: I6c01d2958cf671c29622562689a15ca1ddea0a3c
Closes-bug: #1270693

subject: Re-write sqlite BigInteger mapping test
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-01-23 19:22:33.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/db/test_sqlite.py'], 'message': "Re-write sqlite BigInteger mapping test

This test makes sure that our hook that compiles BigInteger() into
INTEGER for sqlite instead of BIGINT is working as we expect.
Unfortunately, we've seen some problems running the sqlite command to
check the schema.

This patch rewrites the test to only use sqlalchemy APIs and avoid
calling out to the sqlite command for verification.

Change-Id: Id3964d0dd5b0ddf08ab745d6878840ff06b2f0dd
Closes-bug: #1271331
"}]
commit_message:
Re-write sqlite BigInteger mapping test

This test makes sure that our hook that compiles BigInteger() into
INTEGER for sqlite instead of BIGINT is working as we expect.
Unfortunately, we've seen some problems running the sqlite command to
check the schema.

This patch rewrites the test to only use sqlalchemy APIs and avoid
calling out to the sqlite command for verification.

Change-Id: Id3964d0dd5b0ddf08ab745d6878840ff06b2f0dd
Closes-bug: #1271331

subject: Allow flow to be specified as anonymous
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2014-01-23 01:37:01.000000000', 'files': ['taskflow/flow.py', 'taskflow/patterns/linear_flow.py', 'taskflow/engines/action_engine/engine.py', 'taskflow/patterns/unordered_flow.py', 'taskflow/patterns/graph_flow.py'], 'message': 'Allow flow to be specified as anonymous

In order to allow anonymous flows, which will
not be tracked in the logbook or flow_details
we need a way to not have a way to specify these
types of anonymous flows.

To accomplish this allow for a flow name to be
non-existent (but enforce that the root flow must
have a name) or to allow passing in a anonymous
constructor arg when creating a flow.

Change-Id: Ia914586ec993b5a1a0ae61a9dfbd3b27e8a5d9cd
'}]
commit_message:
Allow flow to be specified as anonymous

In order to allow anonymous flows, which will
not be tracked in the logbook or flow_details
we need a way to not have a way to specify these
types of anonymous flows.

To accomplish this allow for a flow name to be
non-existent (but enforce that the root flow must
have a name) or to allow passing in a anonymous
constructor arg when creating a flow.

Change-Id: Ia914586ec993b5a1a0ae61a9dfbd3b27e8a5d9cd

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-01-14 21:57:17.000000000', 'files': ['reference/programs.yaml'], 'message': 'Attach projects to programs

List projects (repositories) attached under each program. Also tracks
if a given project in a program is integrated or incubated.

PTLs oversee projects under their program. Contributing to a project
attached to a program gives you the right to participate in that program
PTL election.

All openstack*/* projects are assigned to a program, except:
- openstack/openstack, openstack/governance and openstack/requirements
  which are affecting everyone (so under the TC supervision)
- openstack-dev/openstack-qa, openstack/melange,
  openstack/openstack-chef, and openstack/python-melangeclient which
  should move to some attic
- openstack-dev/sandbox and openstack/python-openstackclient which
  should be in stackforge

Change-Id: Iac3b71f56e138b582f4f8d1a1abfa1068ac46c55
'}]
commit_message:
Attach projects to programs

List projects (repositories) attached under each program. Also tracks
if a given project in a program is integrated or incubated.

PTLs oversee projects under their program. Contributing to a project
attached to a program gives you the right to participate in that program
PTL election.

All openstack*/* projects are assigned to a program, except:
- openstack/openstack, openstack/governance and openstack/requirements
  which are affecting everyone (so under the TC supervision)
- openstack-dev/openstack-qa, openstack/melange,
  openstack/openstack-chef, and openstack/python-melangeclient which
  should move to some attic
- openstack-dev/sandbox and openstack/python-openstackclient which
  should be in stackforge

commit_message:
Updates common.check_for_exceptions and its calls

Reasons:
- exceptions.from_response has 3 arguments but is being called with
  one argument less, which is url.

Changes:
- Updated common.check_for_exceptions to support urls as needed by
  troveclient.openstack.common.apiclient.exceptions.from_response.
- Adds url to exceptions.from_response calls in troveclient.

Closes-Bug: #1266239

Change-Id: Ie18c90349479f740369f63c48a8d9b463641f84d

commit_message:
make datastore_version_id required

The datastore addition didn't migrate existing instances,
which causes existing installations to blow up after upgrading.
This commit addresses that by inserting best-guess dummy data
into the db.  Operators will need to clean up the values to match
their actual usage.

Change-Id: I7ae064cea9b654a4501b91877b779fb4073623af
Closes-Bug: #1259642

fall back to the old path so that users do not depend on the old path
working forever.

subject: Move default cache dir to persistent location
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-01-22 20:17:50.000000000', 'files': ['os_collect_config/collect.py', 'os_collect_config/tests/test_collect.py', 'README.rst'], 'message': 'Move default cache dir to persistent location

While this is called a "cache", it is important for it to survive. On
reboot, servers may need what was in the cfn config to restore complex
network configurations.

We introduce a new command line option, --backup-cachedir, that will
default to the old path, /var/run/os-collect-config. This will keep
things working for any tools that have been hard coded to use the old
path.

Change-Id: I78b3851b35addfc16913e3cd53c9d0e7eb3d191a
'}]
commit_message:
Move default cache dir to persistent location

While this is called a "cache", it is important for it to survive. On
reboot, servers may need what was in the cfn config to restore complex
network configurations.

We introduce a new command line option, --backup-cachedir, that will
default to the old path, /var/run/os-collect-config. This will keep
things working for any tools that have been hard coded to use the old
path.

Change-Id: I78b3851b35addfc16913e3cd53c9d0e7eb3d191a

commit_message:
Rename generate-interfaces-file.sh...

Rename generate-interfaces-file.sh to dhcp-all-interfaces.sh
so that it is easier to find/remember in the $PATH on a deployed
image.

Also, on some distros the script actually generates many files
so the previous name was a bit confusing.

Change-Id: I7152fa7c28e8ade251311da2cd5f75972423b66c

subject: Make copy_required_libs() more robust
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-01-22 20:55:18.000000000', 'files': ['lib/ramdisk-functions'], 'message': "Make copy_required_libs() more robust

On some systems ldd gives a slightly different output for VDSOs. It doesn't
contain a '=>'. E.g.:
   linux-vdso.so.1 (0x00007fff2f4a6000)
instead of:
   linux-vdso.so.1 => (0x00007fff2f4a6000)
This patch simply skips all entries in the ldd output which don't expand to a

Change-Id: Ie37637890b775b36bb31af4e586e61131bd80fa8

commit_message:
Make copy_required_libs() more robust

On some systems ldd gives a slightly different output for VDSOs. It doesn't
contain a '=>'. E.g.:
   linux-vdso.so.1 (0x00007fff2f4a6000)
instead of:
   linux-vdso.so.1 => (0x00007fff2f4a6000)
This patch simply skips all entries in the ldd output which don't expand to a
path name to workaround that.

Change-Id: Ie37637890b775b36bb31af4e586e61131bd80fa8

subject: Only configure DHCP for real interfaces
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-01-23 21:39:03.000000000', 'files': ['elements/dhcp-all-interfaces/install.d/generate-interfaces-file.sh', 'elements/dhcp-all-interfaces/README.md'], 'message': "Only configure DHCP for real interfaces

Updates the generate-interfaces-file.sh script in
the dhcp-all-interfaces element so that we only
add interfaces that have real MAC addresses.

The generate-interfaces-file.sh script is run early enough
in the boot process (before OVS is initialized) that this
isn't usually a problem unless you execute it manually by hand
after booting. Then you'll end up with network/DHCP
configs for all of your OVS bridges, etc. This
patch avoids configuring all of the virtual interfaces
which have generated MAC addresses.

Change-Id: I7a705084aa5b11305ac0ec5ca37fd2e87a2ae8b7
Closes-bug: 1239479
"}]
commit_message:
Only configure DHCP for real interfaces

Updates the generate-interfaces-file.sh script in
the dhcp-all-interfaces element so that we only
add interfaces that have real MAC addresses.

The generate-interfaces-file.sh script is run early enough
in the boot process (before OVS is initialized) that this
isn't usually a problem unless you execute it manually by hand
after booting. Then you'll end up with network/DHCP
configs for all of your OVS bridges, etc. This
patch avoids configuring all of the virtual interfaces
which have generated MAC addresses.

Change-Id: I7a705084aa5b11305ac0ec5ca37fd2e87a2ae8b7
Closes-bug: 1239479

commit_message:
WIP: Make rabbitmq-server keep state in /mnt/state

Note that it was not using an o-r-c script to be restarted because it
didn't have any config files that might change. We've added one to move
the state now, so we need to restart it.

WIP as this is untested entirely.

Change-Id: I8e12b7e84a355f50b55413a391a4b1c58428af82

subject: Add rally use command
revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2014-01-23 21:15:57.000000000', 'files': ['rally/cmd/main.py', 'rally/fileutils.py', 'tests/cmd/test_main.py', 'tests/cmd/test_envutils.py', 'rally/cmd/envutils.py', 'tests/test_fileutils.py'], 'message': "Add rally use command

This adds a new group of commands : 'rally use'
the first implemented is 'rally use deployment <deploy_id>'

As it is not possible in python to export globaly an env var,it saves the
variable in a file at ~/.rally/deployment like :
RALLY_DEPLOYMENT=1234abcd

For each command that takes a deploy_id as parameter, this
parameter is now optional.

The algorithm to find the deploy_id is as follows :
- If the --deploy-id param is set, use it
- If the environ contains the key 'RALLY_DEPLOYMENT', use it
- load the content of ~/.rally/deployment and if it contains the key
RALLY_DEPLOYMENT, use it
- Else, raise an InvalidArgumentException

Note that I have not been able to use the default arg in @cliutils.args
because it is called before the effective method call. Setting
deploy_id=envutils.default_deployment_id() has the same problem

Partially implements blueprint: rally-use-command

Change-Id: I1e62e26d259bd9e81f1c008058ee9ce91cc3290c
"}]
commit_message:
Add rally use command

This adds a new group of commands : 'rally use'
the first implemented is 'rally use deployment <deploy_id>'

As it is not possible in python to export globaly an env var,it saves the
variable in a file at ~/.rally/deployment like :
RALLY_DEPLOYMENT=1234abcd

For each command that takes a deploy_id as parameter, this
parameter is now optional.

The algorithm to find the deploy_id is as follows :
- If the --deploy-id param is set, use it
- If the environ contains the key 'RALLY_DEPLOYMENT', use it
- load the content of ~/.rally/deployment and if it contains the key
RALLY_DEPLOYMENT, use it
- Else, raise an InvalidArgumentException

Note that I have not been able to use the default arg in @cliutils.args
because it is called before the effective method call. Setting
deploy_id=envutils.default_deployment_id() has the same problem

Partially implements blueprint: rally-use-command

Change-Id: I1e62e26d259bd9e81f1c008058ee9ce91cc3290c

subject: Add os-svc-restart
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 360, 'name': 'Dan Prince', 'email': 'dprince@redhat.com', 'username': 'dan-prince'}, {'_account_id': 4190, 'name': 'lifeless', 'email': 'robertc@robertcollins.net', 'username': 'lifeless'}, {'_account_id': 6449, 'name': 'Chris Jones', 'email': 'cmsj@tenshu.net', 'username': 'cmsj'}, {'_account_id': 6488, 'name': 'Clint Byrum', 'email': 'clint@fewbar.com', 'username': 'clint-fewbar'}, {'_account_id': 6966, 'name': 'Jeffrey J. Walls', 'email': 'jeff.walls@hpe.com', 'username': 'ftcjeff'}, {'_account_id': 7144, 'name': 'James Slagle', 'email': 'jslagle@redhat.com', 'username': 'slagle'}, {'_account_id': 8449, 'name': 'Marios Andreou', 'email': 'marios.andreou@gmail.com', 'username': 'marios'}, {'_account_id': 8532, 'name': 'Ryan Brady', 'email': 'rbrady@redhat.com', 'username': 'rbrady'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-01-23 12:06:02.000000000', 'files': ['elements/os-svc-install/bin/os-svc-enable', 'elements/os-svc-install/bin/os-svc-restart'], 'message': 'Add os-svc-restart

Add os-svc-restart, a helper script to restart a service. It uses
map-services to figure out the actual service name, as the service name
can differ based on the distro being used and also if installing from
source or packages.  Currently, only if the init system is systemd will
a call out to map-services be done. This matches the pattern from
install-packages where map-packages is not used on dpkg systems since
those package names are used as the default in the source install
scripts.

Having a helper script will avoid the proliferation of the following
pattern everywhere:

service foo restart || service foo-by-another-name restart

This also significantly reduces errors in the log due to the above,
which can be misleading.

Depends on Change-Id: Ie7b2dcfa7cabd887d5c212df110d90f9d00a7f65

Change-Id: I15eb2a5db4b0a08e1fb40bda640cd8f224939a92
'}]
commit_message:
Add os-svc-restart

Add os-svc-restart, a helper script to restart a service. It uses
map-services to figure out the actual service name, as the service name
can differ based on the distro being used and also if installing from
source or packages.  Currently, only if the init system is systemd will
a call out to map-services be done. This matches the pattern from
install-packages where map-packages is not used on dpkg systems since
those package names are used as the default in the source install
scripts.

Having a helper script will avoid the proliferation of the following
pattern everywhere:

service foo restart || service foo-by-another-name restart

This also significantly reduces errors in the log due to the above,
which can be misleading.

Depends on Change-Id: Ie7b2dcfa7cabd887d5c212df110d90f9d00a7f65

Change-Id: I15eb2a5db4b0a08e1fb40bda640cd8f224939a92

commit_message:
Add map-services

map-services is used by os-svc-restart from Change-Id:
I15eb2a5db4b0a08e1fb40bda640cd8f224939a92

map-services is not only distro specific, it also needs to be able to
handle different service names for a given distro based on source vs
package installs, since the service names may be different. This is done
via a simple check if the requested service is defined, if it is, we
print the requested name, otherwise, we print the mapped name.

Currently only implemented for Fedora. Support for other distros is
easily implemented just like map-packages.

Change-Id: Ie7b2dcfa7cabd887d5c212df110d90f9d00a7f65

subject: Add action engine scoping ability
revisions:
[{'number': 24, 'created': '2014-01-23 02:14:05.000000000', 'files': ['taskflow/engines/base.py', 'taskflow/examples/resume_from_backend.py', 'taskflow/tests/unit/test_scoping.py', 'taskflow/storage.py', 'taskflow/utils/tiny_tree.py', 'taskflow/engines/action_engine/graph_analyzer.py', 'taskflow/examples/resume_vm_boot.py', 'taskflow/tests/unit/test_arguments_passing.py', 'taskflow/tests/utils.py', 'taskflow/engines/action_engine/task_action.py', 'taskflow/engines/helpers.py', 'taskflow/tests/unit/test_suspend_flow.py', 'taskflow/examples/resume_many_flows/resume_all.py', 'taskflow/persistence/logbook.py', 'taskflow/examples/resume_from_backend.out.txt', 'taskflow/tests/unit/test_duration.py', 'taskflow/tests/unit/test_action_engine.py', 'taskflow/utils/flow_utils.py', 'taskflow/engines/action_engine/graph_action.py', 'taskflow/tests/unit/test_graph_flow.py', 'taskflow/engines/action_engine/engine.py', 'taskflow/utils/graph_utils.py', 'taskflow/tests/unit/test_progress.py', 'taskflow/examples/resume_volume_create.py', 'taskflow/tests/unit/test_flattening.py'], 'message': "Add action engine scoping ability

Add the ability to have a action engine track the
scopes of the tasks it is executing with and have
the tasks which are executed be in different storage
units. Each task has an associated storage unit which
it will use to load and store its own results and the
engine knows the full set of storage units which can
be used to lookup task requirements (which may be in
a different storage unit than task is, ie creating a
set of 'visible' storage unit scopes for that task).

By default, disable scoped usage to retain backwards
compatibility, but allow it to be provided via engine
configuration to allow those who want to use this the
ability to use it.

Action engine no longer provides just a 'storage' property
but also provides a 'storages' property can be used to get
all storage units for an nested flows (along with the root
flow) when scoping is turned on (the original 'storage' property
in that case just returns the root flows storage unit).

Backwards incompatible changes:
* Engine helpers no longer takes a flow_detail as it is now
  possible to have more than one flow_detail/storage unit being
  used at the same time (a flow_detail maps 1:1 to a storage unit,
  and since we can now have multiple storage units active it no
  longer makes sense as part of that api).
* Engine helpers now compiles the engine before returning, this
  allows for injecting of the 'store' dictionary which can
  only be accomplished after compilation (especially if scoping
  is used, since the root storage may be created during compilation).
* Engine base no longer takes a flow_detail as this does not make
  sense for engines which use or create more than one flow detail.

Change-Id: Ib31f65e430e4198403a6bd066173ad9b9cb8d192
"}]
commit_message:
Add action engine scoping ability

Add the ability to have a action engine track the
scopes of the tasks it is executing with and have
the tasks which are executed be in different storage
units. Each task has an associated storage unit which
it will use to load and store its own results and the
engine knows the full set of storage units which can
be used to lookup task requirements (which may be in
a different storage unit than task is, ie creating a
set of 'visible' storage unit scopes for that task).

By default, disable scoped usage to retain backwards
compatibility, but allow it to be provided via engine
configuration to allow those who want to use this the
ability to use it.

Action engine no longer provides just a 'storage' property
but also provides a 'storages' property can be used to get
all storage units for an nested flows (along with the root
flow) when scoping is turned on (the original 'storage' property
in that case just returns the root flows storage unit).

Backwards incompatible changes:
* Engine helpers no longer takes a flow_detail as it is now
  possible to have more than one flow_detail/storage unit being
  used at the same time (a flow_detail maps 1:1 to a storage unit,
  and since we can now have multiple storage units active it no
  longer makes sense as part of that api).
* Engine helpers now compiles the engine before returning, this
  allows for injecting of the 'store' dictionary which can
  only be accomplished after compilation (especially if scoping
  is used, since the root storage may be created during compilation).
* Engine base no longer takes a flow_detail as this does not make
  sense for engines which use or create more than one flow detail.

Change-Id: Ib31f65e430e4198403a6bd066173ad9b9cb8d192

subject: Set default adapter type for monolithic flat disks
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-01-23 02:10:27.000000000', 'files': ['functions'], 'message': "Set default adapter type for monolithic flat disks

upload_image.sh tries to find corresponding metadata in the
descriptor file for a monolithicFlat *-flat.vmdk
If this descriptor is not found, the script sets the disk_type
to preallocated but doesn't set the adapter_type.
Most of the VMs will fail booting without an adapter type.
This patch sets the adapter type to a default value: this value might
not the correct/most optimized but at least it a value is set.

Booting the example VMDK provided
https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/NovaVMware/DeveloperGuide will work.

Closes-Bug: #1271793

Change-Id: Ie3c23a4bb212f30fd078cec6b2b1d604738b595d
"}]
commit_message:
Set default adapter type for monolithic flat disks

upload_image.sh tries to find corresponding metadata in the
descriptor file for a monolithicFlat *-flat.vmdk
If this descriptor is not found, the script sets the disk_type
to preallocated but doesn't set the adapter_type.
Most of the VMs will fail booting without an adapter type.
This patch sets the adapter type to a default value: this value might
not the correct/most optimized but at least it a value is set.

Booting the example VMDK provided
https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/NovaVMware/DeveloperGuide will work.

Closes-Bug: #1271793

Change-Id: Ie3c23a4bb212f30fd078cec6b2b1d604738b595d

subject: Use testtools as base test class
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2013-12-12 12:44:38.000000000', 'files': ['trove/tests/api/instances.py'], 'message': 'Use testtools as base test class

Reasons:
 - The testtools library has been chosen as the project-wide testing base
   class. It works across 2.6 and 2.7 and is a library that aims to develop
   new testing features before inclusion in the standard library. It
   enforces a few elements of correctness, such as always upcalling
   standard methods, as well as providing hooks for features such as detail
   collection and fixtures with cleanup.
Changes:
Minor tests refactoring due to use testtools:
 - fixing api/instance tests:
   tests suits are inherited from testtools.TestCase;
   fix fro skip test;

Change-Id: Iab1e2094413b0c61a665a6492617a676bf49ba89
Closes-Bug: 1179009
'}]
commit_message:
Use testtools as base test class

Reasons:
 - The testtools library has been chosen as the project-wide testing base
   class. It works across 2.6 and 2.7 and is a library that aims to develop
   new testing features before inclusion in the standard library. It
   enforces a few elements of correctness, such as always upcalling
   standard methods, as well as providing hooks for features such as detail
   collection and fixtures with cleanup.
Changes:
Minor tests refactoring due to use testtools:
 - fixing api/instance tests:
   tests suits are inherited from testtools.TestCase;
   fix fro skip test;

Change-Id: Iab1e2094413b0c61a665a6492617a676bf49ba89
Closes-Bug: 1179009

revisions:
[{'number': 20, 'created': '2014-01-23 18:48:29.000000000', 'files': ['trove/taskmanager/models.py'], 'message': 'Adds exception handling to heat code

Reasons:
- In absence of exception handling code, instance status used to be
  always in BUILD state, even if heat code has error'd out.
- status "CREATE_FAILED" of heat stack should also be candidate
  of code failure and instead of executing next code,
  exception should be raised for this status.
- Resource state should also be verified before keeping their IDs.

Changes:
- Exception handling code added, which would set instance status
  to ERROR for any failures.
- Added HEAT_STACK_SUCCESSFUL_STATUSES & HEAT_RESOURCE_SUCCESSFUL_STATES
- Heat Stack status is verified with HEAT_STACK_SUCCESSFUL_STATUSES,
  and raises exception on failure.
- Heat Resource state is verified with HEAT_RESOURCE_SUCCESSFUL_STATES,
  and raises exception on failure.

Change-Id: I307d3d6bbdcd9a46b6ea94e9673ee8d1d97e50bd
Closes-Bug: #1263496
'}]
commit_message:
Adds exception handling to heat code

Reasons:
- In absence of exception handling code, instance status used to be
  always in BUILD state, even if heat code has error'd out.
- status "CREATE_FAILED" of heat stack should also be candidate
  of code failure and instead of executing next code,
  exception should be raised for this status.
- Resource state should also be verified before keeping their IDs.

Changes:
- Exception handling code added, which would set instance status
  to ERROR for any failures.
- Added HEAT_STACK_SUCCESSFUL_STATUSES & HEAT_RESOURCE_SUCCESSFUL_STATES
- Heat Stack status is verified with HEAT_STACK_SUCCESSFUL_STATUSES,
  and raises exception on failure.
- Heat Resource state is verified with HEAT_RESOURCE_SUCCESSFUL_STATES,
  and raises exception on failure.

Change-Id: I307d3d6bbdcd9a46b6ea94e9673ee8d1d97e50bd
Closes-Bug: #1263496

subject: Generate JSON
sync to latest Oslo gettextutils code level
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-01-23 19:23:13.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/openstack/common/gettextutils.py', 'cinder/tests/api/middleware/test_faults.py', 'cinder/tests/test_wsgi.py', 'cinder/api/openstack/wsgi.py'], 'message': 'sync to latest Oslo gettextutils code level

With the goal of getting the latest i18n support integrated
we need to move to the latest gettextutils level.  This merge
implements that:

Commits included:
* 2cfc1a78 Translation Message improvements
* 0e1af5be Implementation of translation log handler
* 9d529dd3 Make Message keep string interpolation args
* ec6d9001 Add support for locales missing from babel

Additional changes were required to move wsgi and its associated test

related-bp: i18n-messages

commit_message:
sync to latest Oslo gettextutils code level

With the goal of getting the latest i18n support integrated
we need to move to the latest gettextutils level.  This merge
implements that:

Commits included:
* 2cfc1a78 Translation Message improvements
* 0e1af5be Implementation of translation log handler
* 9d529dd3 Make Message keep string interpolation args
* ec6d9001 Add support for locales missing from babel

Additional changes were required to move wsgi and its associated test
cases from using get_localized_message() to translate().

related-bp: i18n-messages
Change-Id: Iebdf36bc11852ba4ce5bf0a543536d8de9ddbe87

subject: Whitelist external lazr.authentication requirement
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-01-06 03:48:42.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': "Whitelist external lazr.authentication requirement

* tox.ini(testenv.install_command): Use the --allow-external and
--allow-insecure options so that pip 1.5 and later will assent to
retrieve the lazr.authentication package even though it's not hosted
on PyPI. The --allow-insecure option is aliased to a clearer
--allow-unverified wording in 1.5, but the old form is being used to
avoid breaking users of 1.4.x and will be valid at least through
1.6.x according to comments in the pip source.

Change-Id: I52342a805a8b0b5ade7de494b1fd9b4079b93263
"}]
commit_message:
Whitelist external lazr.authentication requirement

* tox.ini(testenv.install_command): Use the --allow-external and
--allow-insecure options so that pip 1.5 and later will assent to
retrieve the lazr.authentication package even though it's not hosted
on PyPI. The --allow-insecure option is aliased to a clearer
--allow-unverified wording in 1.5, but the old form is being used to
avoid breaking users of 1.4.x and will be valid at least through
1.6.x according to comments in the pip source.

Change-Id: I52342a805a8b0b5ade7de494b1fd9b4079b93263

subject: Limit puppet-mysql module version from the top
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6926, 'name': 'Bogdan Dobrelya', 'email': 'bdobreli@redhat.com', 'username': 'bogdando'}, {'_account_id': 7195, 'name': 'Matthew Mosesohn', 'email': 'raytrac3r@gmail.com', 'username': 'mmosesohn'}, {'_account_id': 8776, 'name': 'Vladimir Sharshov', 'email': 'vsharshov@mirantis.com', 'username': 'warpc'}, {'_account_id': 8786, 'name': 'Vladimir Kuklin', 'email': 'aglarendil@gmail.com', 'username': 'aglarendil'}, {'_account_id': 8787, 'name': 'Dmitry Borodaenko', 'email': 'angdraug@gmail.com', 'username': 'angdraug'}, {'_account_id': 8971, 'name': 'Fuel CI', 'username': 'fuel-ci', 'inactive': True, 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 9037, 'name': 'Dmitry Ilyin', 'email': 'idv1985@gmail.com', 'username': 'dilyin'}, {'_account_id': 9387, 'name': 'Aleksandr Didenko', 'email': 'adidenko@mirantis.com', 'username': 'AD'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-01-21 16:28:14.000000000', 'files': ['deployment/puppet/neutron/Modulefile', 'deployment/puppet/nova/.fixtures.yml', 'deployment/puppet/ceilometer/Modulefile', 'deployment/puppet/glance/.fixtures.yml', 'deployment/puppet/keystone/Modulefile', 'deployment/puppet/glance/Modulefile', 'deployment/puppet/keystone/.fixtures.yml', 'deployment/puppet/swift/Modulefile'], 'message': 'Limit puppet-mysql module version from the top

Since mysql::python was deprecated by 01/01/2014
(see https://github.com/puppetlabs/puppetlabs-mysql/
commit/c22e72a97a4665a17178f358db72c73c3a5c70db)
all puppet modules' dependencies and spec's fixtures
relying on puppetlabs-mysql module/repo would fail, if
mysql::python is used as is in Fuel now, thus should be
fixed approrpiately, i.e.:
1) limit mysql dependencies in Modulefiles to <1.0.0
according to their upstream versions
(see https://bugs.launchpad.net/puppet-openstack/+bug/1271168)
2) add "ref:  'origin/0.x'" for mysql repos in .fixtures.yml

Closes-bug: #1270807

Change-Id: I28a0de33b6b749eb7f0270af02c4b369a032a13e
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobrelia@mirantis.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Limit puppet-mysql module version from the top

Since mysql::python was deprecated by 01/01/2014
(see https://github.com/puppetlabs/puppetlabs-mysql/
commit/c22e72a97a4665a17178f358db72c73c3a5c70db)
all puppet modules' dependencies and spec's fixtures
relying on puppetlabs-mysql module/repo would fail, if
mysql::python is used as is in Fuel now, thus should be
fixed approrpiately, i.e.:
1) limit mysql dependencies in Modulefiles to <1.0.0
according to their upstream versions
(see https://bugs.launchpad.net/puppet-openstack/+bug/1271168)
2) add "ref:  'origin/0.x'" for mysql repos in .fixtures.yml

Closes-bug: #1270807

Change-Id: I28a0de33b6b749eb7f0270af02c4b369a032a13e
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobrelia@mirantis.com>

Add date file packaging for rootwrap.conf

The setup.cfg wasn't including the etc/oslo-rootwrap/rootwrap.conf file
so when building the package it was not included.  This patch adds the
packaging entry for the config file.

subject: Fix regular expression for finding IP in ha_delete_vips test
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-01-23 11:56:11.000000000', 'files': ['fuelweb_test/tests/test_ha.py'], 'message': "Fix regular expression for finding IP in ha_delete_vips test

The test searchs for secondary IP address and deletes it.
In order to find ip it parses output of 'ip address show'
command using reqular expression. Old one finds
not a secondary ip address but first in a string.
The new one a bit smarter.

Change-Id: I345e151c8d2cc0083bc0b1e6bb8691969778a84f
"}]
commit_message:
Fix regular expression for finding IP in ha_delete_vips test

The test searchs for secondary IP address and deletes it.
In order to find ip it parses output of 'ip address show'
command using reqular expression. Old one finds
not a secondary ip address but first in a string.
The new one a bit smarter.

Change-Id: I345e151c8d2cc0083bc0b1e6bb8691969778a84f

commit_message:
Add a _config_options function to Marconi

This function is necessary for options discoverability and manual
options registration. This first patch adds a config function to every
module defining options in marconi. Those functions were registered as
entrypoints that will then be loaded by the configuration sample
generator.

Change-Id: I2c351c14c7e1b104926162336ed3567696c62dfb

commit_message:
Don't use `override_time` but mock instead

Closes-bug: #1266962

We're moving away from using the set_override_time function in
timeutils. The right way to do it should be by using mock.

Change-Id: Ic69c5c5d66cb39d668015c368add10b108684549

Unfortunately --gpg-auto-import-keys on "zypper ar" does
not really work on openSUSE 13.1. use a separate ref step
which imports the GPG key properly.

Change-Id: Ieea05078c903ca780bc3b808500bae527677134a
'}]
commit_message:
Properly import GPG key for repository

Unfortunately --gpg-auto-import-keys on "zypper ar" does
not really work on openSUSE 13.1. use a separate ref step
which imports the GPG key properly.

commit_message:
Sync oslo-cache from oslo-incubator

This patch removes Marconi's local copy of the oslo-incubator cache
work. The patch also removes the memcached backend, although the version
coming from oslo doesn't have support for it yet. The backend will be
pulled in again as soon as it is updated upstream.

Change-Id: I487b2178d9657eb7abe020f06436b14531bdb993

commit_message:
LxcProvider network refactoring

Tunnels are used for ip connectivity between nodes. This makes
possible to use LxcProvider in any environment, and deploy
clouds with huge number of nodes.

Class LxcContainer has been replaced by more convenient LxcHost.

Added new exception ConfigValidationError.

blueprint multihost-deploy

Change-Id: Iff287468535afc0840d4d233bf393c7ddf02b911

Change-Id: I60e31806edafd71de62a1809f047a8ad772094cc

commit_message:
Drop msgpack dependency

We've been using msgpack just to pack the API document into sqlite
binary documents. This is easily achievable with json. We can pull
msgpack in again when there's a real use case for it.

Change-Id: I60e31806edafd71de62a1809f047a8ad772094cc

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1561, 'name': 'Russell Bryant', 'email': 'rbryant@redhat.com', 'username': 'russellb'}, {'_account_id': 1779, 'name': 'Daniel Berrange', 'email': 'berrange@redhat.com', 'username': 'berrange'}, {'_account_id': 2243, 'name': 'John Griffith', 'email': 'john.griffith8@gmail.com', 'username': 'john-griffith'}, {'_account_id': 5754, 'name': 'Alex Xu', 'email': 'hejie.xu@intel.com', 'username': 'xuhj'}, {'_account_id': 9578, 'name': 'DB Datasets CI', 'email': 'turbo-hipster@lists.rcbops.com', 'username': 'turbo-hipster', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-01-22 22:33:06.000000000', 'files': ['etc/nova/nova.conf.sample', 'nova/tests/virt/libvirt/test_libvirt_utils.py', 'nova/virt/libvirt/utils.py'], 'message': 'Make clearing lvm volumes optional

Clearing lvm volumes used when CONF.libvirt.image_type=lvm is done for
security reasons.  Some people may prefer turning this off for better
performance if they are not concerned about the security aspect.

The new option defaults to "zero", which is the secure default and
matches current behavior.  The name of the configuration option and its
possible values match the similar option that exists in Cinder.

The help text for the new config option is written to make it very clear
that if you change this, you are accepting that you are making your
system vulnerable to CVE-2012-5625.

DocImpact
Implements blueprint lvm-clear-option

Change-Id: I930f5cc09fcbcb5b73742774083b1126bf9243e0
'}]
commit_message:
Make clearing lvm volumes optional

Clearing lvm volumes used when CONF.libvirt.image_type=lvm is done for
security reasons.  Some people may prefer turning this off for better
performance if they are not concerned about the security aspect.

The new option defaults to "zero", which is the secure default and
matches current behavior.  The name of the configuration option and its
possible values match the similar option that exists in Cinder.

The help text for the new config option is written to make it very clear
that if you change this, you are accepting that you are making your
system vulnerable to CVE-2012-5625.

DocImpact
Implements blueprint lvm-clear-option

Change-Id: I930f5cc09fcbcb5b73742774083b1126bf9243e0

Remove unused method 'string_to_bool' from utils

The method 'string_to_bool' in utils is not used.

we should use 'bool_from_string' from oslo cliutils
to replace it.

commit_message:
Remove old school TOCI files

Removes a bunch of the now deprecated toci_* files which now
exists in a different form under tripleo-incubator/scripts/devtest_*.

These scripts served us well over the past few months but the
time has come to focus this project solely on CI.

Well done old toci_*. Thanks for helping us raise the bar.

Change-Id: I4b9ec09e2c841c8b9374d21ea9f442cbe2ef53d3

subject: ipmitool's _power_status raises IPMIFailure
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2014-01-23 15:02:55.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/tests/drivers/test_ipmitool.py', 'ironic/drivers/modules/ipmitool.py'], 'message': "ipmitool's _power_status raises IPMIFailure

Modified ipmitool's _power_status() so that it raises an IPMIFailure exception
instead of a non-IronicException that the ipmitool call might raise. With this
change, ipmitool only returns IronicExceptions.

Also, made minor change to IPMIToolDriverTestCase.test_set_power_invalid_state()
to specifically test for an InvalidParameterValue exception (instead of any
IronicException).

Change-Id: Ieb7dd9fe50737dce6a5c6c6c9142b944a00859d6
Partial-Bug: #1267693
"}]
commit_message:
ipmitool's _power_status raises IPMIFailure

Modified ipmitool's _power_status() so that it raises an IPMIFailure exception
instead of a non-IronicException that the ipmitool call might raise. With this
change, ipmitool only returns IronicExceptions.

Also, made minor change to IPMIToolDriverTestCase.test_set_power_invalid_state()
to specifically test for an InvalidParameterValue exception (instead of any
IronicException).

Change-Id: Ieb7dd9fe50737dce6a5c6c6c9142b944a00859d6
Partial-Bug: #1267693

commit_message:
Use cls instances instead of object in benchmarks

Using @classmethod as a base for scenarios was actually caused
by historical reasons (of using pytest as a base for benchmarks)
As we don't use it anymore (for a long time) we are able to simplify
benchmark framework and use cls instances and plain methods.

This is only the first step. That just make required changes and fix
unit tests. In next patchset I will refactor & clean exisitng unit tests.

blueprint refactor-scenarios-to-use-class-instances

Change-Id: Idd270635f70731ccf575174f8f96dc1e95cc0f8a

subject: Replace keystone service and endpoint with catalog
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-01-21 18:40:24.000000000', 'files': ['doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_lay_of_land.xml'], 'message': 'Replace keystone service and endpoint with catalog

This commit replaces the use of keystone service and keystone endpoint
with the "keystone catalog" command. The main reason for doing this is
because the service/endpoint commands only work when the Keystone
catalog has a SQL backend. It does not work with the templated catalog
backend. The templated catalog backend is becoming more popular in
environments due to the simplicity of a single text file as well as
the decreased load seen on databases by not querying for endpoints.

Change-Id: I17f9dab499e056cb198f79325c0213399f729a51
'}]
commit_message:
Replace keystone service and endpoint with catalog

This commit replaces the use of keystone service and keystone endpoint
with the "keystone catalog" command. The main reason for doing this is
because the service/endpoint commands only work when the Keystone
catalog has a SQL backend. It does not work with the templated catalog
backend. The templated catalog backend is becoming more popular in
environments due to the simplicity of a single text file as well as
the decreased load seen on databases by not querying for endpoints.

Change-Id: I17f9dab499e056cb198f79325c0213399f729a51

commit_message:
Add job-binary-data-create to CLI

The /job-binary-internals endpoint is used to store data in an
internal Savanna data store for later retrieval when a job is run. It
should only be used when Swift is not available.

Implements: blueprint python-savannaclient-cli
Change-Id: I8bb7ca72b3e3009a531cc06d20c2c70414c0ddde

commit_message:
Fix duplicate uuid error fo pxe tests

PXEPrivateMethodsTestCase in some cases creates two node
but uuid for this nodes is not generated, but hardcoded
in order to pass test__build_pxe_config

Uuid should be hardcoded in test explicitly and generated
if not setted

Change-Id: Ib1befec383e274ab59590d758aebef9604246f92

subject: Fix PXE _parse_driver_info() exception message
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-01-10 12:32:06.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/drivers/modules/pxe.py'], 'message': 'Fix PXE _parse_driver_info() exception message

In order to distinguish the parameters from one driver to another we use
self-namespace for the parameters name, so when raising an exception
to the client about an invalid parameter value we should also use the
self-namespaced version of the parameters name.

Change-Id: I087ff0b201ccf0287d79d7e711222692916411f9
'}]
commit_message:
Fix PXE _parse_driver_info() exception message

In order to distinguish the parameters from one driver to another we use
self-namespace for the parameters name, so when raising an exception
to the client about an invalid parameter value we should also use the
self-namespaced version of the parameters name.

Change-Id: I087ff0b201ccf0287d79d7e711222692916411f9

subject: Fix SSL .crt error when not using SSL.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-01-22 16:42:14.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/devtest_overcloud.sh'], 'message': 'Fix SSL .crt error when not using SSL.

Fix an issue with 1845a169f9f38597e86d77ceee93be9f82f1713a where
SSLBASE was required to be set in order to use devtest_overcloud.sh.

This patch adds a check for SSLBASE variable and only tries to load the
associated .crt and .key files if it is set.

Change-Id: I09e800e78401ade52a0a21df7e33956c055e2c88
Closes-bug: 1271639
'}]
commit_message:
Fix SSL .crt error when not using SSL.

Fix an issue with 1845a169f9f38597e86d77ceee93be9f82f1713a where
SSLBASE was required to be set in order to use devtest_overcloud.sh.

This patch adds a check for SSLBASE variable and only tries to load the
associated .crt and .key files if it is set.

Change-Id: I09e800e78401ade52a0a21df7e33956c055e2c88
Closes-bug: 1271639

commit_message:
Add fencing agent script as a separated task

Based on nailgun agent, should be installed the same way
To run unit tests use:
rspec ./bin/fencing-agent_spec.rb --color --format documentation

Requirements for tests:
ruby 1.9.3p429 / 1.8.7p371
rspec 2.14.7
---------------------
httpclient (2.3.4.1)
json (1.8.1)
logger (1.2.8)
ohai (6.20.0)
rethtool (0.0.3)

Depends on: https://review.openstack.org/66607
Implements blueprint: fencing-in-nailgun-agent

Change-Id: Iceee47c47d35969f4ff08a0eb5b1e74b12b8b92f
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobrelia@mirantis.com>

commit_message:
Routing notifier

Takes a yaml-based config file
(see etc/oslo/routing_notifier.yaml.sample) via
routing_notifier_config option.

Events may be routed by priority or event_type.

Implements: blueprint configurable-notification
Change-Id: I437dfac348f387044e6da3d6a0bbb208323c1741

Add share's networks API

Add server side for share's networks. Implemented controller
will carry user requests to the DB and thus will allow
user to manage share's networks data.

Add share's networks support to the share API.

Partially implements bp: join-tenant-network

commit_message:
Add share's networks DB model, API and neutron support

Add share's networks DB models and API for managing
data about tenant's networks.
Add neutron network plug-in which will be responsible
for managing neutron network resources (creating
and deleting ports).

Partially implements bp: join-tenant-network

Change-Id: I20249f3640a10fc3ed55003a817a994efdb64681

subject: Respect region name when processing domain URL
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2014-01-21 02:14:35.000000000', 'files': ['keystoneclient/v3/client.py', 'keystoneclient/httpclient.py'], 'message': 'Respect region name when processing domain URL

When deprecating the use of management_url from service_catalog we
updated the management_url setter for the project scoped token, however
we missed the domain scoped token case.

There is actually nothing we can do here to test this scenario as the
backwards compatibility code that was installed handles this for us and
there is no problem, however we should not be internally relying on
deprecated code.

Change-Id: I59bac4d9d74f2eb8bc6edd40518c7cd5a4fe1343
'}]
commit_message:
Respect region name when processing domain URL

When deprecating the use of management_url from service_catalog we
updated the management_url setter for the project scoped token, however
we missed the domain scoped token case.

There is actually nothing we can do here to test this scenario as the
backwards compatibility code that was installed handles this for us and
there is no problem, however we should not be internally relying on
deprecated code.

Change-Id: I59bac4d9d74f2eb8bc6edd40518c7cd5a4fe1343

commit_message:
Avoid checking out triple- related repositories twice

openstack/tripleo-incubator, openstack/diskimage-builder
openstack/tripleo-image-elements and openstack/tripleo-heat-templates
were checked out twice, once with "-" and once with "_". Only
one instance is needed.

Change-Id: Icb76fbe6153f585625a44ae8c97e47590c82b1ae
