subject: Add fallback test in __check_interfaces_correctness
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 8392, 'name': 'Aleksey Kasatkin', 'email': 'akasatkin@mirantis.com', 'username': 'aleksey'}, {'_account_id': 8749, 'name': 'Evgeniy L', 'email': 'eli@mirantis.com', 'username': 'evgeniyl'}, {'_account_id': 8787, 'name': 'Dmitry Borodaenko', 'email': 'angdraug@gmail.com', 'username': 'angdraug'}, {'_account_id': 8797, 'name': 'Andrew Woodward', 'email': 'xarses@gmail.com', 'username': 'xarses'}, {'_account_id': 8829, 'name': 'Ryan Moe', 'email': 'rmoe@mirantis.com', 'username': 'rmoe'}, {'_account_id': 8971, 'name': 'Fuel CI', 'username': 'fuel-ci', 'inactive': True, 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2014-01-22 22:29:45.000000000', 'files': ['nailgun/nailgun/test/integration/test_node_collection_handlers.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/network/manager.py'], 'message': 'Add fallback test in __check_interfaces_correctness

In some cases, it may be OK for there to be an admin interface
 that is outside the admin network. To support this case we we will
 test if the interface mac matches the mac that contacted us, if this
 is the case, we will use this interface.

This prevents the NetworkManager from erroneously removing interfaces
 from an otherwise valid node.

Resolves-bug: #1271043

Change-Id: I04120d538e2efba6cb7a04cfbd7cb4852f2576c9
'}]
commit_message:
Add fallback test in __check_interfaces_correctness

In some cases, it may be OK for there to be an admin interface
 that is outside the admin network. To support this case we we will
 test if the interface mac matches the mac that contacted us, if this
 is the case, we will use this interface.

This prevents the NetworkManager from erroneously removing interfaces
 from an otherwise valid node.

Resolves-bug: #1271043

Change-Id: I04120d538e2efba6cb7a04cfbd7cb4852f2576c9

There is need for a Climate Scheduler filter in Nova, as
we need to make sure the hosts in the pools won't be scheduled
by other queries than Climate ones.

asking this specific pool

See [1] for adding a custom filter thanks to Nova.conf

Implements bp:host-filter

[1]

Change-Id: I069b8525a6d85ace07ba86a23e54b76b33d533e7

commit_message:
Implement Nova filter for Host Reservation Pools

There is need for a Climate Scheduler filter in Nova, as
we need to make sure the hosts in the pools won't be scheduled
by other queries than Climate ones.
We also need to make sure that the user has enough rights for
asking this specific pool

See [1] for adding a custom filter thanks to Nova.conf

Implements bp:host-filter

[1]
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/nova/devref/filter_scheduler.html

Change-Id: I069b8525a6d85ace07ba86a23e54b76b33d533e7

subject: There is no need to bash boostrap keystone
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-01-22 20:00:12.000000000', 'files': ['recipes/registration.rb'], 'message': 'There is no need to bash boostrap keystone

With the introduction of the keystone LWRP back in the Grizzly days,
this fragile bootstrap routine was made obsolete. The LWRP already
makes use of the bootstrap token to create various new users by way
of the registration recipe and/or a custom recipe defined by the user
which declares keystone LWRP resources.

Also, this is Chef, not bash.

Change-Id: Iac688e28a17c1ec0eb3a57da5f9a0f54b66e503d
'}]
commit_message:
There is no need to bash boostrap keystone

With the introduction of the keystone LWRP back in the Grizzly days,
this fragile bootstrap routine was made obsolete. The LWRP already
makes use of the bootstrap token to create various new users by way
of the registration recipe and/or a custom recipe defined by the user
which declares keystone LWRP resources.

Also, this is Chef, not bash.

Change-Id: Iac688e28a17c1ec0eb3a57da5f9a0f54b66e503d

subject: Update oslo.messaging requirement to use git
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2013-12-23 14:29:28.000000000', 'files': ['dev-requirements.txt'], 'message': "Update oslo.messaging requirement to use git

We probably shouldn't be gating on alphas for not-yet-released
libraries. Since oslo.messaging commits are being gated against all
projects, it should be safe to use the development version as opposed to
cutting alpha releases.

Once it'll be released, this requirement will go away and the stable
version will be added to the global-requirements.txt file.

Related-bug: #1261253

Change-Id: I98dbdccdffb7bf628cc533a1dd099505258b02f0
"}]
commit_message:
Update oslo.messaging requirement to use git

We probably shouldn't be gating on alphas for not-yet-released
libraries. Since oslo.messaging commits are being gated against all
projects, it should be safe to use the development version as opposed to
cutting alpha releases.

Once it'll be released, this requirement will go away and the stable
version will be added to the global-requirements.txt file.

Related-bug: #1261253

Change-Id: I98dbdccdffb7bf628cc533a1dd099505258b02f0

commit_message:
Workaround broken udev update on openSUSE

Delete stale symlinks created by current openSUSE 13.1
for kpartx loopback partitions. Those break bootloader
installation otherwise.

Change-Id: I13a7387e341b4426b459610fd1d3c49ce5730f46

subject: Making glance service names consistent
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-01-23 05:19:54.000000000', 'files': ['recipes/registry.rb', 'spec/api_spec.rb', 'spec/registry_spec.rb', 'recipes/api.rb', 'README.md'], 'message': "Making glance service names consistent

Right now for most cookbooks we declare resources with the name of the
service itself. So, for example, in the 'identity' cookbook, the
'keystone' service is called 'keystone'. The other cookboks follow this
same standard.

Why is this important? Things like omnibus-openstack depend on these
cookbooks having a common standard. That, and well, standards make us
all happy.

Change-Id: I3b1cb845cfb21b5e1d46feca322f3c2788431a27
"}]
commit_message:
Making glance service names consistent

Right now for most cookbooks we declare resources with the name of the
service itself. So, for example, in the 'identity' cookbook, the
'keystone' service is called 'keystone'. The other cookboks follow this
same standard.

Why is this important? Things like omnibus-openstack depend on these
cookbooks having a common standard. That, and well, standards make us
all happy.

Change-Id: I3b1cb845cfb21b5e1d46feca322f3c2788431a27

subject: Use a mirrored mirror log
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-01-17 01:22:37.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/brick/local_dev/lvm.py'], 'message': "Use a mirrored mirror log

By default, LVM will sync the two mirrors of a logical volume on
creation. This is I/O intensive and it takes a long time though, so we
tell it not to with --nosync. The next default behavior is to create a
mirror log which says what portions of the mirrors are in sync. But
then if a disk backing a mirror log fails, we have to deal with
resyncing the mirrors at each reboot.

This commit tells LVM to use a mirrored mirror log, which will use
approximately 4MB of extra space, but means we'll never have to
sync mirrors, ever.

Change-Id: I6586ced4e7e66ae79ae134406a4c633f8fbc8602
"}]
commit_message:
Use a mirrored mirror log

By default, LVM will sync the two mirrors of a logical volume on
creation. This is I/O intensive and it takes a long time though, so we
tell it not to with --nosync. The next default behavior is to create a
mirror log which says what portions of the mirrors are in sync. But
then if a disk backing a mirror log fails, we have to deal with
resyncing the mirrors at each reboot.

This commit tells LVM to use a mirrored mirror log, which will use
approximately 4MB of extra space, but means we'll never have to
sync mirrors, ever.

Change-Id: I6586ced4e7e66ae79ae134406a4c633f8fbc8602

subject: remove extra newlines that eventlet seems to add
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-01-19 21:32:36.000000000', 'files': ['openstack/common/log.py'], 'message': 'remove extra newlines that eventlet seems to add

in the last month info lines in nova logs for wsgi requests are
getting extra new lines. This is suspected to be because eventlet
wsgi is adding those in, and using the WritableLogger. Do an rstrip
here to not have our logs full of blanks.

Change-Id: I130b08b1b4b5a48ecfa6418e7576d2bae2884f9e
'}]
commit_message:
remove extra newlines that eventlet seems to add

in the last month info lines in nova logs for wsgi requests are
getting extra new lines. This is suspected to be because eventlet
wsgi is adding those in, and using the WritableLogger. Do an rstrip
here to not have our logs full of blanks.

Change-Id: I130b08b1b4b5a48ecfa6418e7576d2bae2884f9e

commit_message:
Move KDS paths file

Paths are really only needed for testing so they should live in the
testing directory rather that in the application code.

We don't really need the paths we had as they are used for static
directories and template directories, neither of which are used.

Change-Id: I14aa5e332e7df2b21311fe369a1f2706efee4cc3

subject: Explicitly set NetworkID for create server in case 2+ networks are available
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-01-21 14:45:35.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/api/compute/base.py', 'tempest/services/compute/xml/servers_client.py', 'tempest/services/compute/v3/xml/servers_client.py'], 'message': "Explicitly set NetworkID for create server in case 2+ networks are available

When running Tempest against a non-Devstack environment, several networks
may be available to the Tempest user. This patch explicitly sets on which
network newly created server must be connected. It reuses the config flag
fixed_network_name.

Some code borrowed from Rohan Kanade's patch #61037

Closes-Bug: #1250866

Change-Id: I666f3fda43629fb23ae16a961f5d2a1eb27f00a1
"}]
commit_message:
Explicitly set NetworkID for create server in case 2+ networks are available

When running Tempest against a non-Devstack environment, several networks
may be available to the Tempest user. This patch explicitly sets on which
network newly created server must be connected. It reuses the config flag
fixed_network_name.

Some code borrowed from Rohan Kanade's patch #61037

Closes-Bug: #1250866

Change-Id: I666f3fda43629fb23ae16a961f5d2a1eb27f00a1

commit_message:
allowed-adress-pair-ext: Fix response code

The documentation states that Normal Response Code is 200 OK. The Normal
Response Code is in fact 201.

Closes-bug: #1270945
Signed-off-by: Emilien Macchi <emilien.macchi@enovance.com>

subject: Enable lazy translation
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-01-14 20:02:21.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/contrib/kds/cli/api.py', 'bin/keystone-manage', 'bin/keystone-all', 'httpd/keystone.py'], 'message': 'Enable lazy translation

This change makes it so that if the user makes a request with an
Accept-Language header and the response is an error where the
message is translatable, then the message will be translated to
the requested language (or the most appropriate language
available).

completes bp user-locale-api

Change-Id: I5b0b02e0459a6a444baa12f8722adb829b7e152b
'}]
commit_message:
Enable lazy translation

This change makes it so that if the user makes a request with an
Accept-Language header and the response is an error where the
message is translatable, then the message will be translated to
the requested language (or the most appropriate language
available).

completes bp user-locale-api

Change-Id: I5b0b02e0459a6a444baa12f8722adb829b7e152b

subject: Added step to restart Nova after configuring it for Neutron
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-01-22 19:04:11.000000000', 'files': ['doc/install-guide/section_neutron-install.xml'], 'message': 'Added step to restart Nova after configuring it for Neutron

I added a step to restart the Nova API service on the controller node
after configuring Nova to use Neutron for networking. We should
consider backporting this patch to Havana since the issue probably
leaves the controller node in an indeterminate state until the
operator restarts services or reboots the system during the
troubleshooting process.

After some discussion with Steve Gordon, I updated this patch to also
include restarting nova-scheduler and nova-conductor for completeness.

Change-Id: I63c25aa285616ee95ecde2d685f52103809adec7
Closes-Bug: #1269253
(cherry picked from commit cda14042c86d610c0dd5c43d735e0ad2ba2dae1a)
'}]
commit_message:
Added step to restart Nova after configuring it for Neutron

I added a step to restart the Nova API service on the controller node
after configuring Nova to use Neutron for networking. We should
consider backporting this patch to Havana since the issue probably
leaves the controller node in an indeterminate state until the
operator restarts services or reboots the system during the
troubleshooting process.

After some discussion with Steve Gordon, I updated this patch to also
include restarting nova-scheduler and nova-conductor for completeness.

Change-Id: I63c25aa285616ee95ecde2d685f52103809adec7
Closes-Bug: #1269253
(cherry picked from commit cda14042c86d610c0dd5c43d735e0ad2ba2dae1a)

subject: Fix of bug 1268852 As per tesmpest design, if setup method fails in particular test file, teardown method will not be executed from the base class.
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 7, 'name': 'Jay Pipes', 'email': 'jaypipes@gmail.com', 'username': 'jaypipes'}, {'_account_id': 5174, 'name': 'Mauro Rodrigues', 'email': 'maurosr@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'maurosr'}, {'_account_id': 5196, 'name': 'Matthew Treinish', 'email': 'mtreinish@kortar.org', 'username': 'treinish'}, {'_account_id': 5803, 'name': 'Attila Fazekas', 'email': 'afazekas@redhat.com', 'username': 'afazekas'}, {'_account_id': 8205, 'name': 'Mh Raies', 'email': 'raiesmh08@gmail.com', 'username': 'raiesmh08'}, {'_account_id': 9008, 'name': 'VMware NSX CI', 'username': 'vmwareminesweeper', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2014-01-23 07:01:45.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/api/network/test_vpnaas_extensions.py', 'tempest/api/network/base.py'], 'message': 'Fix of bug 1268852
As per tesmpest design, if setup method fails in particular test file,
teardown method will not be executed from the base class.

As per reported bug, if network creation is successful but vpnservice
creation failed in the setup, created network will not be get cleaned.

To resolve this issue we have two methods -
1. Use try catch in all setup methods in each test file.
2. Define a decorator in the base file and use that decorator in the
test file to make the setup failure handling generic.

Due to being global solution second method will be more effecient and
so is used here.

Fixes LP bug #1268852

Change-Id: I2dc113763c19bb7bcf263586d8dd00a242334030
'}]
commit_message:
Fix of bug 1268852
As per tesmpest design, if setup method fails in particular test file,
teardown method will not be executed from the base class.

As per reported bug, if network creation is successful but vpnservice
creation failed in the setup, created network will not be get cleaned.

To resolve this issue we have two methods -
1. Use try catch in all setup methods in each test file.
2. Define a decorator in the base file and use that decorator in the
test file to make the setup failure handling generic.

Due to being global solution second method will be more effecient and
so is used here.

Fixes LP bug #1268852

Change-Id: I2dc113763c19bb7bcf263586d8dd00a242334030

Fix syntax error in docs

There are several syntax errors in docs.
The patch will add missing punctuation, remove extra whitespace, and
change the "heat-api-engine" to "heat-engine" in heat-engine.rst.

commit_message:
Remove vim header

No need to set tabstop tons of times, this can be set in your vimrc
file instead.

More disucssion:
http://openstack.10931.n7.nabble.com/Remove-vim-modelines-td21780.html

Change-Id: I3b830a5bb831a63c188109e6fad66ba48884fff3
Partial-Bug: #1229324

commit_message:
Get rid of duplication in metadata modification

There were 2 functions recursive_keypairs and dict_to_keyval.
To avoid confusion it was decided to use only recursive_keypairs
because it is commonly used in data manipulation.
But dict_to_keyval was used in sql implementation so that's why we need
migration.

Fixes bug: 1268618

Change-Id: I55e6f3ad40e28b5e34e056d8639bb9e6a79d105f

The API docs say you can filter the roles list by name, but currently
this only works when specifying a user or group, so pass kwargs in
both requests so the global role list can be filtered by name.

Change-Id: I4b3bf28c5c050c5999256cd392531b289e1df723
'}]
commit_message:
Enable filtering list roles by name

The API docs say you can filter the roles list by name, but currently
this only works when specifying a user or group, so pass kwargs in
both requests so the global role list can be filtered by name.

Change-Id: I4b3bf28c5c050c5999256cd392531b289e1df723

subject: Add extra resource to the compute node object
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-01-14 21:31:42.000000000', 'files': ['nova/objects/compute_node.py', 'nova/tests/objects/test_compute_node.py', 'nova/tests/objects/test_service.py'], 'message': 'Add extra resource to the compute node object

In changeset 4c21f4a82300683f55102f91ae28eca9f81c24e7, an
extra_resources column added to the DB to support extensible
resource tracker.

A corresponding field is needed in the compute node object. The
new filed is a list of object, and each of the object is a subclass
of ComputeResource, so that compute node can provide interface in
future to allocate/free/reserve/commit resources.

Implements: blueprint extensible-resource-tracking

Change-Id: I6244bdd1758c7ded86a6d3767c2d61fa76faeeaa
Signed-off-by: Yunhong Jiang <yunhong.jiang@intel.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Add extra resource to the compute node object

In changeset 4c21f4a82300683f55102f91ae28eca9f81c24e7, an
extra_resources column added to the DB to support extensible
resource tracker.

A corresponding field is needed in the compute node object. The
new filed is a list of object, and each of the object is a subclass
of ComputeResource, so that compute node can provide interface in
future to allocate/free/reserve/commit resources.

Implements: blueprint extensible-resource-tracking

Change-Id: I6244bdd1758c7ded86a6d3767c2d61fa76faeeaa
Signed-off-by: Yunhong Jiang <yunhong.jiang@intel.com>

commit_message:
Fix admin can't delete vm

When an admin user in one tenant creates a VM in a network belonging
to a different tenant, the code currently doesn't allow the admin to
delete the VM. This patch allows an admin user to delete the VM in
this case.

Change-Id: Ie7f73b18444ff6f0cfe3d7fc02de26eae2954d0c
Closes-bug: #1261633

commit_message:
Support timezone in memcached token backend

This patch fixes bug #1221087.

Replaces time.mktime() to calendar.timegm() in utils.unixtime()
to get correct expiration time.

After this patch, Memcached token backend does not depend on timezone.
So remove the section "Memcached and System Time" in configuration
manual.

DocImpact

Change-Id: I17233c8a79d01a37abdbd46934ad486ddc8caec9
(cherry picked from commit 1bb67a74aca9823e6d1d8335b150841adef3ee73)

subject: Check image id format before executing operations
revisions:
[{'number': 13, 'created': '2014-01-21 05:23:32.000000000', 'files': ['glance/tests/functional/db/base.py', 'glance/db/sqlalchemy/api.py', 'glance/tests/functional/db/test_sqlalchemy.py'], 'message': "Check image id format before executing operations

DB2 will raise 'CLI0109E String data right truncation' error if
the given query parameter is longer than the column definition.
As a result, user will run into 500 instead of 404 error though
the malformed id is not existed in DB.
This fix will add image id format checking before executing real
operations.

Closes-Bug: #1263684

Change-Id: I1ab3e38724014032d9290e7dde3f8b6d23b6df6c
"}]
commit_message:
Check image id format before executing operations

DB2 will raise 'CLI0109E String data right truncation' error if
the given query parameter is longer than the column definition.
As a result, user will run into 500 instead of 404 error though
the malformed id is not existed in DB.
This fix will add image id format checking before executing real
operations.

Closes-Bug: #1263684

Change-Id: I1ab3e38724014032d9290e7dde3f8b6d23b6df6c

commit_message:
Added resources support in pollster's interface

1. Change the pollster's interface to support resources:
- Added optional parameter 'resources' to the method get_samples. It
  specifies a list of the endpoints from which the pollster would get
  data.

2. Change the PollingTask to record the resources for each pollster.

3. Pass the resources recorded in PollingTask to the pollsters in
central agent.

This patch only changes the interface of pollsters and PollingTask in
central agent. The existing central agent's pollsters still ignore the
resources passed in by the PollingTask.

Implements: blueprint support-resources-pipeline-item
Change-Id: Ic7a83c63ea291d0527004113bc8d8bb09311d14f

commit_message:
Add a new ThreadGroupManager class

Introduce a ThreadGroupManager class to manage active ThreadGroups for
engine services and move the thread-related EngineService methods to
ThreadGroupManager.  This will make it easier for multiple engine
services to manage thread groups.

Partial-Bug: #1262012
Change-Id: I1ce7785021726c274a294ef402b036540d395a29

subject: Fix 'network_name' not assinged When booting a vm with admin role and assigning it with another tenant's private network, it's fine to work. But the update info cache action will started periodically, at this time, the previous mentioned other tenant's private network is filtered out by function "get_available_network()" The exception happened since the network utilized is out. The worst affect is the vm can not be deleted normally. This patch fix it by give the variable net_ids value to function "get_available_network", so the current using network won't be out. commit_message:
Fix 'network_name' not assingedWhen booting a vm with admin role and assigning it withanother tenant's private network, it's fine to work. Butthe update info cache action will started periodically,at this time, the previous mentioned other tenant's privatenetwork is filtered out by function "get_available_network()"The exception happened since the network utilized is out.The worst affect is the vm can not be deleted normally.This patch fix it by give the variable net_ids value to function"get_available_network", so the current using network won't beout.Change-Id: I7d0d1aa5ac6c23b5f0c3913261832e062252fea0Closes-bug: #1271405# Please enter the commit message for your changes. Lines starting# with '#' will be ignored, and an empty message aborts the commit.# On branch fix_1271405# Changes to be committed:#   (use "git reset HEAD^1 <file>..." to unstage)##	modified:   nova/network/neutronv2/api.py#	modified:   nova/tests/network/test_neutronv2.py#

Change-Id: Ic983835380302daac71f101f53def3f65fa1ce10

commit_message:
Correctly deal with the no-SSL case in overcloud

Commit 1845a16 added support for SSL on the overcloud, but it does not
correctly cope if SSL support is not specified, setting the cert file
to '.crt', which is plainly incorrect. Guard that setting with a -n.

Change-Id: I760d1917806afad67e928181f84520ed8ccf03dd

commit_message:
Sync OPENSTACK_KEYSTONE_DEFAULT_ROLE with keystone

For now, keystone default role is _member_, while horizon set
OPENSTACK_KEYSTONE_DEFAULT_ROLE to Member. It will really be user
friendly to modify horizon default value to _member_ to sync with
keystone's default setting.

Change-Id: I55d15e6cfb74e52e933c5a44efd6c27930415738
Closes-Bug: #1264228

in python3.x, there is no method named xrange(),
it has replaced by range(),which is equal to xrange()
in python2.x. so we must fix this issue.

Closes-Bug: #1268439
Change-Id: I7aa8fe80155710cd639721d4b3d5bd9b4219e27d
'}]
commit_message:
use six.move.xrange replace xrange

in python3.x, there is no method named xrange(),
it has replaced by range(),which is equal to xrange()
in python2.x. so we must fix this issue.
we use six moduleto fix this issue.

Closes-Bug: #1268439
Change-Id: I7aa8fe80155710cd639721d4b3d5bd9b4219e27d

revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2014-01-17 11:02:33.000000000', 'files': ['ceilometer/tests/test_pipeline.py', 'etc/ceilometer/pipeline.yaml', 'doc/source/measurements.rst'], 'message': 'Add new rate-based disk and network pipelines

Addresses: BP rates-derived-from-cumulative

Add new pipeline config to derive rate-based gauge meters
from the current set of cumulative disk and network meters
gathered by the compute agent.

The latter form of meter is not suitable for alarming
against a static threshold, whereas rate-based meters would
allow for example autoscaling actions to be driven off the
observed per-second rates of I/O.

Change-Id: I5764797d4eebb129b66a1524d47c38282c6ef095
'}]
commit_message:
Add new rate-based disk and network pipelines

Addresses: BP rates-derived-from-cumulative

Add new pipeline config to derive rate-based gauge meters
from the current set of cumulative disk and network meters
gathered by the compute agent.

The latter form of meter is not suitable for alarming
against a static threshold, whereas rate-based meters would
allow for example autoscaling actions to be driven off the
observed per-second rates of I/O.

Change-Id: I5764797d4eebb129b66a1524d47c38282c6ef095

commit_message:
assertTrue(isinstance) replace by assertIsInstance

some of tests use different method of assertTrue(isinstance(A, B))
or assertEqual(type(A), B). The correct way is to use
assertIsInstance(A, B) provided by testtools

Change-Id: I7072fef7fe5f76e526fc0ccca7a4894accaae80f
Closes-Bug: #1268480

commit_message:
Pull Bug #1263122 fix for service module from Oslo

Get latest service module from Oslo mainly to avoid the impact of
bug #1263122 when multi-process API service is enabled.

Follow commits are included in this change:
* 8b2b0b7 2013-12-20 | Use hacking import_exceptions for gettextutils._
* 37e46bb 2013-12-20 | disable SIGHUP restart behavior in foreground
* 12bcdb7 2013-10-11 | Remove vim header

Change-Id: I506ff809c32542520cc6ba2fa07519b1361f439c

commit_message:
Fix logic for "nova flavor-show 0#"

For perviously logic, if flavor id is
start with "0Number", int(name_or_id)
will convert it to "Number". If flavor
id "Number" exist in DB, it will show
up for query with "0Number".
This fix enter flavor search logic at
the beginning. Also add one more UT
for this function.

Change-Id: Ic48ff4275978404064c0c6fce6f98181660aa84a
Fixes: bug 1268456

commit_message:
cinder v2 api tests - fix volume client

This is a legacy problem in change
I712a90d39981564af09393ed1b7f4be12897c808

1. move cls.volumes_client, cls.volumes_extension_client
   cls.snapshots_client from BaseVolumeTest into
   subclass(BaseVolumeV1Test)
2. delete call cls.volumes_client.keystone_auth as it is
   called automatically in request method of RestClient.

Change-Id: I5184de9911e3fe9a3c23c2c4f84e59596f10b77c

revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2014-01-18 07:48:28.000000000', 'files': ['heat/engine/resources/autoscaling.py', 'heat/tests/test_signal.py', 'heat/engine/resources/instance.py', 'heat/tests/generic_resource.py', 'heat/engine/resources/wait_condition.py', 'heat/engine/signal_responder.py'], 'message': 'Allow choice in how SignalResponder user id is stored.

Some subclasses of SignalResponder may assign a resource_id
with the real reasource that it creates.

With this change, the user_id is always stored in resource data.
If user_id resource data is missing an assumption is made that
this resource was created before this commit, so the
resource_id is used as the user_id.

Subclasses of SignalResponder which previously used the
user ID as their resource_id now need to call resource_id_set
themselves during handle_create.

Change-Id: Iac41ab99f8e9b0953b2cd447ff0e027443fabeca
'}]
commit_message:
Allow choice in how SignalResponder user id is stored.

Some subclasses of SignalResponder may assign a resource_id
with the real reasource that it creates.

With this change, the user_id is always stored in resource data.
If user_id resource data is missing an assumption is made that
this resource was created before this commit, so the
resource_id is used as the user_id.

Subclasses of SignalResponder which previously used the
user ID as their resource_id now need to call resource_id_set
themselves during handle_create.

Change-Id: Iac41ab99f8e9b0953b2cd447ff0e027443fabeca

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2014-01-06 16:46:58.000000000', 'files': ['trove/instance/views.py', 'trove/common/cfg.py', 'etc/trove/trove.conf.test', 'trove/tests/unittests/instance/test_instance_views.py', 'etc/trove/trove.conf.sample'], 'message': 'Instance details view shows hostname (if it has it) or IP

Currently the hostname and IP is controlled by two config values:
trove_dns_support and add_addresses. I dont see a point of having
the hostname and IP indenpendent. It causes issues for old instances
when DNS is enabled.

I propose to simplify the view by showing hostname if it is set or
show the IP if it is not set.

Closes-bug: #1260567

Change-Id: Ia1fd47cbee89b10d53b0821e104a34eb31543846
'}]
commit_message:
Instance details view shows hostname (if it has it) or IP

Currently the hostname and IP is controlled by two config values:
trove_dns_support and add_addresses. I dont see a point of having
the hostname and IP indenpendent. It causes issues for old instances
when DNS is enabled.

I propose to simplify the view by showing hostname if it is set or
show the IP if it is not set.

Closes-bug: #1260567

Change-Id: Ia1fd47cbee89b10d53b0821e104a34eb31543846

commit_message:
Replace assertTrue with explicit assertIsInstance

assertIsInstance can provide useful message when test fails,
this patch replaces assertTrue(isinstance(x, y)) with
assertIsInstance(x, y).

Change-Id: I1a36b4f343c881b6690389753270d35599b758ab
Closes-Bug: #1268480

commit_message:
Rewrite pieces of code deprecated by Django 1.7

The mimtype argument of HttpResponse, SimpleTemplateResponse,
TemplateResponse, and render_to_response was removed; one should
use content_type instead

Change-Id: I62214c37264845dbabf006a32616e894c4ac9e3a
Closes-bug: #1266676
Partially-impelements: blueprint django-1point6

commit_message:
Fixing typo "existant". Must be "existent"

Negative tests that use the word "existant" are being corrected to "existent".
The current framework has random usage of the word 'existant' instead of
'existent'.

Change-Id: I4219c372befbd8235757f124d1414317d9b01f72

commit_message:
More network debugging detail

* devstack-vm-gate-wrap.sh: Sometimes devstack-gate runs fail for
reasons related to the local network. Include IPv6 addresses in
addition to the IPv4 addressing previously displayed, and add
routing and ARP tables as well.

Change-Id: I771b6081758020cf1521443d1bd15a27ede7f2b1

commit_message:
PXE instance_name is no longer mandatory

With the use of node.uuid as the property to build the directory
name for the instance images, instance_name is not longer needed
to validate the pxe driver info.

commit_message:
Add tool to document cli tools

Call "os_doc_tools/commands.py" nova to generate a file
section_cli_nova_commands.xml with the command line options.

Allows generation of all supported clients with --all command.
The tool gets installed as: openstack-auto-commands

subject: import CONF.fake_network in linux_net
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-01-22 01:45:14.000000000', 'files': ['nova/network/linux_net.py'], 'message': "import CONF.fake_network in linux_net

CONF.fake_network is used in nova.network.linux_net but wasn't imported.
Because CONF is a global object this bug was hidden when
CONF.fake_network was imported elsewhere. This bug was only seen when
running nova-api-metadata which we don't test in the gate.

Change-Id: I33db193c64be5f100dc376cb8b2baeac8390442c
Closes-Bug: #1270845
"}]
commit_message:
import CONF.fake_network in linux_net

CONF.fake_network is used in nova.network.linux_net but wasn't imported.
Because CONF is a global object this bug was hidden when
CONF.fake_network was imported elsewhere. This bug was only seen when
running nova-api-metadata which we don't test in the gate.

Change-Id: I33db193c64be5f100dc376cb8b2baeac8390442c
Closes-Bug: #1270845

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2014-01-22 19:31:36.000000000', 'files': ['api-ref/src/docbkx/ch_identity-admin-v2.xml', 'api-ref/src/docbkx/ch_identity-v3.xml', 'api-quick-start/src/docbkx/api-quick-start-intro.xml', 'api-ref/src/docbkx/ch_identity-v2.xml'], 'message': "Remove references to '24 hour' tokens

The token lifespan used by a deployment is configurable via
`keystone.conf [token] expiration` - it may not be 24 hours.

In fact, bp reduce-default-token-duration recently reduced the default
token duration from 24 hours to just one hour. The keystone community
expects to tweak this value over the next several releases, so I've
avoided using a specific value here to reduce maintenance effort.

https://blueprints.launchpad.net/keystone/+spec/reduce-default-token-duration

Change-Id: I86afd624c2d8ef4de3275ebaf3ceab80ef324f3e
"}]
commit_message:
Remove references to '24 hour' tokens

The token lifespan used by a deployment is configurable via
`keystone.conf [token] expiration` - it may not be 24 hours.

In fact, bp reduce-default-token-duration recently reduced the default
token duration from 24 hours to just one hour. The keystone community
expects to tweak this value over the next several releases, so I've
avoided using a specific value here to reduce maintenance effort.

https://blueprints.launchpad.net/keystone/+spec/reduce-default-token-duration

Change-Id: I86afd624c2d8ef4de3275ebaf3ceab80ef324f3e

commit_message:
Setup ccache symlinks on openSUSE

openSUSE's ccache package doesn't include symlinks to enable ccache
for gcc by default, so we set them up manually.

subject: Enable driver methods without explicit 'task' arg
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-01-22 19:14:36.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/conductor/task_manager.py'], 'message': "Enable driver methods without explicit 'task' arg

Enable calling driver methods (eg, set_power_state) without explicitly
passing a TaskManager instance as an arg to the method. Because many
driver methods are decorated with task_manager.require_exclusive_lock,
this decorator must now be able to pull the relevant TaskManager
instance from the calling scope.

Change-Id: I74027d129fc6ecea9712beba3037cca008cc4c0e
Related-bug: 1259346
"}]
commit_message:
Enable driver methods without explicit 'task' arg

Enable calling driver methods (eg, set_power_state) without explicitly
passing a TaskManager instance as an arg to the method. Because many
driver methods are decorated with task_manager.require_exclusive_lock,
this decorator must now be able to pull the relevant TaskManager
instance from the calling scope.

Change-Id: I74027d129fc6ecea9712beba3037cca008cc4c0e
Related-bug: 1259346

commit_message:
Token Revocation Extension

Base API for reporting revocation events.

The initial implementation only has support for an in memory KVS backing store
More backends are planned, specifically a SQL based. The KVS Backend will be
upgraded to use the Dogpile backed KVS stores.

The default revoke provider is a Fake Provider; it does not record anything.
It will be called from  many places in the code, and that code would be much
more verbose if it is conditional.
If the extension is removed from the pipeline, the revoke calls
will not be accessable. Thus, to use this, both add the extension to the
pipeline and add a backend other than the fake one.

Change-Id: Ida468d8a230494ba28d71574b70d5d0b6da26571

subject: Make neutron-openvswitch-agent run cleanup.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-01-21 20:45:09.000000000', 'files': ['elements/neutron-openvswitch-agent/element-deps'], 'message': "Make neutron-openvswitch-agent run cleanup.

Whenever we install the neutron-openvswitch-agent we should
also install the ovs-cleanup utility.

1) cleanup any OVS ports created by neutron

2) Also cleanup other non-neutron created OVS ports as well. This is
 really important since we want to get a DHCP address on
 a reboot (DHCP fails early on since OVS isn't fully initialized).
 init-neutron will always move any NICs back the bridge anyway...

Change-Id: Id1fdab5337296b17865c0fff85a8852c03c7968a
"}]
commit_message:
Make neutron-openvswitch-agent run cleanup.

Whenever we install the neutron-openvswitch-agent we should
also install the ovs-cleanup utility.

1) cleanup any OVS ports created by neutron

2) Also cleanup other non-neutron created OVS ports as well. This is
 really important since we want to get a DHCP address on
 a reboot (DHCP fails early on since OVS isn't fully initialized).
 init-neutron will always move any NICs back the bridge anyway...

Change-Id: Id1fdab5337296b17865c0fff85a8852c03c7968a

commit_message:
Add utils to work with OpenStack components

Add utils to do basic actions with nova and keystone.
We decide to store in utils/openstack/%service_name.py service
specific clients in classes named like Climate%service_name%Client.
In this classes we define service client with specific variables.
Also, we redefine __getattr__ like this:

   def __getattr__(self, name):
       fn = getattr(self.%service_name, name)
       return fn

Change-Id: I47e0d8689f1d8ca8aba0372eb5e7a4a80f2f9be5

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-01-22 20:01:27.000000000', 'files': ['nova/db/watchdog_actions.py', 'nova/tests/virt/libvirt/test_libvirt.py', 'nova/exception.py', 'nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py', 'nova/tests/virt/libvirt/test_libvirt_config.py', 'nova/virt/libvirt/config.py'], 'message': "Add watchdog device support to libvirt driver

This commit adds support for watchdog devices
to the libvirt driver.  The watchdog device
used is 'i6300esb', and the action is based
on the 'watchdog:action' extra spec of the flavor,
or the 'watchdog:action' property of the image
(which will override the flavor value if present).

Change-Id: I3d1b472937e7143b6be25085090c98d71b224689
"}]
commit_message:
Add watchdog device support to libvirt driver

This commit adds support for watchdog devices
to the libvirt driver.  The watchdog device
used is 'i6300esb', and the action is based
on the 'watchdog:action' extra spec of the flavor,
or the 'watchdog:action' property of the image
(which will override the flavor value if present).

This is the second commit introducing watchdog devices

Implements: blueprint libvirt-watchdog

Change-Id: I3d1b472937e7143b6be25085090c98d71b224689

Some gate failures showed that subprocess.Popen.communicate() may raise
an OSError where the proper response is to just call it again.  This
patch adds that handling.

Closes-bug: #1271331

commit_message:
Catch OSError in processutils

Some gate failures showed that subprocess.Popen.communicate() may raise
an OSError where the proper response is to just call it again.  This
patch adds that handling.

Change-Id: Ibca16d2141ca3aacacc73062757c97a3220bd02d
Closes-bug: #1271331

commit_message:
Fix E501 in individual openstack projects

In different individual projects length of domain value differs, so sometimes
it's causing failure of pep8, because line of definition is longer
than 80 symbols.

Fix bug: 1271625

Change-Id: Ifb57ff99769b0e576697190ee80f33b00fe5644b

allowing the manager classes to be provided a callback

Change-Id: Idc7e55ade6b3f80c348123fbceea64425d7d3508

commit_message:
Allow a on_load_failure_callback to be provided

When entrypoints are loaded it is sometimes useful
to be able to do more than LOG the failure that could
be emitted from the plugin failing to be constructed,
allowing the manager classes to be provided a callback
that can be called when such extension fails to load
is useful to track these types of failures.

commit_message:
Rearrange condition to check if PATH_INFO exists

The condition check for the PATH_INFO key does not
consider the case where the PATH_INFO field is either
non-existent or has a "None" value. It checks for the
length of the key value without first checking for
the existence of the key

Switched the if/elif clauses and using "get" to
avoid KeyError

Closes-Bug: #1270378
Change-Id: I4b03baccf26fd830d9997972efa9f980460633b9

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-01-21 00:11:03.000000000', 'files': ['doc/install-guide/section_neutron-install.xml'], 'message': 'Added step to restart Nova after configuring it for Neutron

I added a step to restart the Nova API service on the controller node
after configuring Nova to use Neutron for networking. We should
consider backporting this patch to Havana since the issue probably
leaves the controller node in an indeterminate state until the
operator restarts services or reboots the system during the
troubleshooting process.

After some discussion with Steve Gordon, I updated this patch to also
include restarting nova-scheduler and nova-conductor for completeness.

Change-Id: I63c25aa285616ee95ecde2d685f52103809adec7
Closes-Bug: #1269253
'}]
commit_message:
Added step to restart Nova after configuring it for Neutron

I added a step to restart the Nova API service on the controller node
after configuring Nova to use Neutron for networking. We should
consider backporting this patch to Havana since the issue probably
leaves the controller node in an indeterminate state until the
operator restarts services or reboots the system during the
troubleshooting process.

After some discussion with Steve Gordon, I updated this patch to also
include restarting nova-scheduler and nova-conductor for completeness.

Change-Id: I63c25aa285616ee95ecde2d685f52103809adec7
Closes-Bug: #1269253

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-01-17 16:39:58.000000000', 'files': ['nova/exception.py', 'nova/tests/objects/test_block_device.py', 'nova/objects/block_device.py'], 'message': 'Make block device objects handle nothing in the db

This patch makes block device objects handle the situation when the db
query comes back empty better. In case of get_by_volume_id, a
VolumeBDMNotFound exception (also introduced in this patch) will be thrown.

In case  of get_by_instance_uudi, an empty list will be returned rather
then throwing an unhelpful exception.

Also takes the opportunity to convert mox to mock in block device
objects tests.

Change-Id: Idd7bbb800774886af984380e4c5750c1570f9311

commit_message:
Make block device objects handle nothing in the db

This patch makes block device objects handle the situation when the db
query comes back empty better. In case of get_by_volume_id, a
VolumeBDMNotFound exception (also introduced in this patch) will be thrown.

In case  of get_by_instance_uudi, an empty list will be returned rather
then throwing an unhelpful exception.

Also takes the opportunity to convert mox to mock in block device
objects tests.

Part of the blueprint: icehouse-objects

Change-Id: Idd7bbb800774886af984380e4c5750c1570f9311

subject: server 500 should not be a client error
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-01-20 01:05:07.000000000', 'files': ['glanceclient/common/http.py'], 'message': "server 500 should not be a client error

the client should not log a server 50x response at ERROR level.
It already throws an exception, so the caller can care about what
it wants to do with this. This error will show up regularly in
nova that succeed, and there is no way to disable this message,
which isn't an error from Nova's perspective without turning off
*all* the logs.

Set this to debug instead, because from a caller perspective that's
what you want out of this.

Change-Id: I6d0efb53d1e81adf309f7fa580ec5a8073a811c5
"}]
commit_message:
server 500 should not be a client error

the client should not log a server 50x response at ERROR level.
It already throws an exception, so the caller can care about what
it wants to do with this. This error will show up regularly in
nova that succeed, and there is no way to disable this message,
which isn't an error from Nova's perspective without turning off
*all* the logs.

Set this to debug instead, because from a caller perspective that's
what you want out of this.

Change-Id: I6d0efb53d1e81adf309f7fa580ec5a8073a811c5

subject: Allow updating empty created v2 images from v1
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 616, 'name': 'Mark Washenberger', 'email': 'mark.washenberger@markwash.net', 'username': 'markwash'}, {'_account_id': 6484, 'name': 'Feilong Wang', 'email': 'hustemb@gmail.com', 'username': 'flwang'}, {'_account_id': 6549, 'name': 'Zhi Yan Liu', 'email': 'lzy.dev@gmail.com', 'username': 'lzy-dev'}, {'_account_id': 9290, 'name': 'David Koo', 'username': 'dkoo', 'inactive': True}, {'_account_id': 9410, 'name': 'Yanis Guenane', 'email': 'yguenane@redhat.com', 'username': 'yguenane'}, {'_account_id': 9520, 'name': 'David Koo (koofoss)', 'email': 'david.koo@huawei.com', 'username': 'koofoss'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-01-20 02:07:51.000000000', 'files': ['glanceclient/v1/images.py', 'tests/v1/test_images.py'], 'message': 'Allow updating empty created v2 images from v1

When an empty image is created through python-glanceclient using v2 APIs
but updated using v1 APIs, python-glanceclient crashes with a "int()
argument must be a string or a number, not 'NoneType'" message.

This is because v1.images.ImageManager._format_image_meta_for_user
expects the 'size' (and 'min_ram' and 'min_disk') field of an image to
be convertible to 'int' but the server-side v2 APIs set it to 'None' for
an empty image. Therefore the conversion to int fails with the message
above.

This fix modifies _format_image_meta_for_user to check whether or not a
field can be converted to 'int' and, if not, returns 0 (zero) as the
value instead.

Tests have also been added.

Change-Id: I86680bc06c8ce3ee492efeb3f32071da4f293bcd
Closes-bug: #1258160
'}]
commit_message:
Allow updating empty created v2 images from v1

When an empty image is created through python-glanceclient using v2 APIs
but updated using v1 APIs, python-glanceclient crashes with a "int()
argument must be a string or a number, not 'NoneType'" message.

This is because v1.images.ImageManager._format_image_meta_for_user
expects the 'size' (and 'min_ram' and 'min_disk') field of an image to
be convertible to 'int' but the server-side v2 APIs set it to 'None' for
an empty image. Therefore the conversion to int fails with the message
above.

This fix modifies _format_image_meta_for_user to check whether or not a
field can be converted to 'int' and, if not, returns 0 (zero) as the
value instead.

Tests have also been added.

Change-Id: I86680bc06c8ce3ee492efeb3f32071da4f293bcd
Closes-bug: #1258160

subject: fix(mongodb): Ensure batch message posts are atomic (all or nothing)
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2014-01-17 21:53:54.000000000', 'files': ['marconi/queues/storage/mongodb/messages.py', 'marconi/queues/storage/mongodb/utils.py'], 'message': 'fix(mongodb): Ensure batch message posts are atomic (all or nothing)

In the case of a network failure it is not possible to discover which,
if any, of the messages in a given batch were inserted before the
outage occurred.

This patch works around the problem by inserting messages in two
phases:

1. Assign all messages a "batch" or "group" ID and insert them
2. Once it has been confirmed that *all* messages were inserted
   correctly, finalize the transaction by clearing the batch
   ID, 'g', from the messages just inserted.

Message listing and counting were also modified to ignore any
non-finalized messages, i.e., those messages that have a non-null
'g' value.

Orphaned messages will eventually expire and be cleaned up as
usual via the TTL index.

Closes-Bug: #1270263
Change-Id: I9de61cdfdf6dfcbe07ef76bf63a293091f087663
'}]
commit_message:
fix(mongodb): Ensure batch message posts are atomic (all or nothing)

In the case of a network failure it is not possible to discover which,
if any, of the messages in a given batch were inserted before the
outage occurred.

This patch works around the problem by inserting messages in two
phases:

1. Assign all messages a "batch" or "group" ID and insert them
2. Once it has been confirmed that *all* messages were inserted
   correctly, finalize the transaction by clearing the batch
   ID, 'g', from the messages just inserted.

Message listing and counting were also modified to ignore any
non-finalized messages, i.e., those messages that have a non-null
'g' value.

Orphaned messages will eventually expire and be cleaned up as
usual via the TTL index.

Closes-Bug: #1270263
Change-Id: I9de61cdfdf6dfcbe07ef76bf63a293091f087663

revisions:
[{'number': 11, 'created': '2014-01-18 05:34:57.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/virt/libvirt/test_libvirt_utils.py', 'nova/virt/libvirt/utils.py', 'nova/virt/libvirt/imagebackend.py'], 'message': "Fix rbd backend not working for none admin ceph user

The 'rbd_user' option allows nova administrators to override the default user
account used for RBD operations, with one that has potentially lower
privileges.  Not all parts of the Nova code honoured the 'rbd_user' option,
which resulted in failures when attempting to use a lesser privileged user for
RBD. This fix ensures the '--id' and '--config' parameters are passed to the
RBD command line tools in all cases.

Change-Id: Id99aa303791143360ad78074184583048e4878f0
Close-bug: 1255536
"}]
commit_message:
Fix rbd backend not working for none admin ceph user

The 'rbd_user' option allows nova administrators to override the default user
account used for RBD operations, with one that has potentially lower
privileges.  Not all parts of the Nova code honoured the 'rbd_user' option,
which resulted in failures when attempting to use a lesser privileged user for
RBD. This fix ensures the '--id' and '--config' parameters are passed to the
RBD command line tools in all cases.

Change-Id: Id99aa303791143360ad78074184583048e4878f0
Close-bug: 1255536

subject: Oslo: Make AMQP based RPC consumer threads more robust
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-01-09 16:22:58.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/openstack/common/excutils.py', 'cinder/openstack/common/rpc/impl_qpid.py', 'cinder/openstack/common/rpc/impl_kombu.py'], 'message': 'Oslo: Make AMQP based RPC consumer threads more robust

bug 1189711 Should RPC consume_in_thread() be more fault tolerant?

There are unprotected holes in the thread kicked off by RPC
consume_in_thread such that an exception will kill the thread.
This exists for both the service (TopicConsumer) and the new
reply proxy (DirectConsumer) consumers. This patch plugs
those holes as close to the base of the consumer thread as
possible by catching all non-caught exceptions and retrying
with sleeps between retries and some pacing of the log
output to prevent log flooding.

(cherry picked from commit 22ec8ff616a799085239e3e529daeeefea6366c4)

Conflicts:
	cinder/openstack/common/rpc/impl_kombu.py
	cinder/openstack/common/rpc/impl_qpid.py

Change-Id: I99d0186e4c87bda3130102f6ce8f37a19a36d3fc
'}]
commit_message:
Oslo: Make AMQP based RPC consumer threads more robust

bug 1189711 Should RPC consume_in_thread() be more fault tolerant?

There are unprotected holes in the thread kicked off by RPC
consume_in_thread such that an exception will kill the thread.
This exists for both the service (TopicConsumer) and the new
reply proxy (DirectConsumer) consumers. This patch plugs
those holes as close to the base of the consumer thread as
possible by catching all non-caught exceptions and retrying
with sleeps between retries and some pacing of the log
output to prevent log flooding.

(cherry picked from commit 22ec8ff616a799085239e3e529daeeefea6366c4)

Conflicts:
	cinder/openstack/common/rpc/impl_kombu.py
	cinder/openstack/common/rpc/impl_qpid.py

Change-Id: I99d0186e4c87bda3130102f6ce8f37a19a36d3fc

commit_message:
Fixed concurrency error in session handling

Singleton implementation were failing in case of conncurent access to
session object in case we are trying to access several databases in the same time.

Change-Id: I18efc6668ab039760393105757fc98c124bc3007

commit_message:
Adding status field to image location

Adding a status field to image's each location property, each location
status can be 'active', 'pending_delete' and 'deleted'.

Under location's status information Scrubber service can make cleanup
based on DB records also but not a dedicated queue-file for each image.

Implement bp: image-location-status

Change-Id: I373545747e66bc397650d9b7381674fcfa5d3ac3
Signed-off-by: Zhi Yan Liu <zhiyanl@cn.ibm.com>

subject: Cleanup neutron provider router example
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2014-01-21 21:59:00.000000000', 'files': ['doc/install-guide/section_neutron-provider-router-with-private_networks.xml'], 'message': "Cleanup neutron provider router example

* Don't define keystone admin variables, they are not needed and would
  override the other variabels
* Define variables in 'adminrc' instead of 'novarc' (nova is not used in
  the section)
* Don't automate the sourcing of 'adminrc' in bashrc since the admin
  might not want to always be logged in the admin tenant
* Use the 'admin' tenant as provider tenant, since this is the one that
  was created earlier in the guide. Explain why this tenant is used.
* Try to respect conventions
* Improve commands used to create network objects:
  - set dns servers for tenant_A subnet
  - explicitly define the provider network configuration

Change-Id: Ice2db30360a3fbecd64237bc2a3c97a9d0e4b0d9
Closes-Bug: #1266643
"}]
commit_message:
Cleanup neutron provider router example

* Don't define keystone admin variables, they are not needed and would
  override the other variabels
* Define variables in 'adminrc' instead of 'novarc' (nova is not used in
  the section)
* Don't automate the sourcing of 'adminrc' in bashrc since the admin
  might not want to always be logged in the admin tenant
* Use the 'admin' tenant as provider tenant, since this is the one that
  was created earlier in the guide. Explain why this tenant is used.
* Try to respect conventions
* Improve commands used to create network objects:
  - set dns servers for tenant_A subnet
  - explicitly define the provider network configuration

Change-Id: Ice2db30360a3fbecd64237bc2a3c97a9d0e4b0d9
Closes-Bug: #1266643

subject: v3 credentials, ensure blob response is json
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 4, 'name': 'Dolph Mathews', 'email': 'dolph.mathews@gmail.com', 'username': 'dolph'}, {'_account_id': 1916, 'name': 'Guang Yee', 'email': 'gyee@suse.com', 'username': 'guang-yee'}, {'_account_id': 2218, 'name': 'Adam Young', 'email': 'adam@younglogic.com', 'username': 'ayoung'}, {'_account_id': 4328, 'name': 'Steven Hardy', 'email': 'steven.hardy@suse.com', 'username': 'shardy'}, {'_account_id': 9954, 'name': 'Lance Bragstad', 'username': 'lbragstad', 'inactive': True}]
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2014-01-17 11:45:57.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/credential/controllers.py', 'keystone/tests/test_v3_credential.py'], 'message': 'v3 credentials, ensure blob response is json

The v3/credentials API specifies the blob response to be json, but
due to bug #1259584, any credentials stored via the ec2tokens extension
will incorrectly return a dict.  This makes it hard for clients (and
in particular users migrating from ec2tokens to v3/credentials) to
handle the blob data consistently, so add a workaround to ensure the
response is always serialized as json if the existing DB contents is
a dict instead of a json string.

Change-Id: I340cdf4e565fdadacb41b39acace3948aafb9b92
Related-Bug: #1259584
Closes-Bug: #1269637
'}]
commit_message:
v3 credentials, ensure blob response is json

The v3/credentials API specifies the blob response to be json, but
due to bug #1259584, any credentials stored via the ec2tokens extension
will incorrectly return a dict.  This makes it hard for clients (and
in particular users migrating from ec2tokens to v3/credentials) to
handle the blob data consistently, so add a workaround to ensure the
response is always serialized as json if the existing DB contents is
a dict instead of a json string.

Change-Id: I340cdf4e565fdadacb41b39acace3948aafb9b92
Related-Bug: #1259584
Closes-Bug: #1269637

commit_message:
Store ec2 credentials blob as json

For compatibility with the v3/credentials API, the blob dict should
be stored serialized as json.  To maintain backwards compatibility
with existing DB contents stored via the ec2tokens interface, we
fall back to the previous behavior if we fail to load the blob.

Change-Id: I21f068c308df5aa6a818031d3bc86a81b2bd25f4
Closes-Bug: #1259584

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-01-16 21:42:00.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/credential/controllers.py', 'keystone/tests/test_v3_credential.py'], 'message': 'Store trust_id for v3/credentials ec2 keypairs

To fix bug #1259584 without re-opening the vulnerablility fixed in
bug #1242597, we need to store the trust_id in the data blob when
storing an ec2 keypair via the v3/credentials API.  This is already
done when keypairs are created/stored via the ec2tokens interface,
so this aligns the behavior when the credentials are created via
v3/credentials.

Change-Id: I8443d30dffed4201b46d10cef6a0bb43ccdcddc1
Partial-Bug: #1259584

commit_message:
Store trust_id for v3/credentials ec2 keypairs

To fix bug #1259584 without re-opening the vulnerablility fixed in
bug #1242597, we need to store the trust_id in the data blob when
storing an ec2 keypair via the v3/credentials API.  This is already
done when keypairs are created/stored via the ec2tokens interface,
so this aligns the behavior when the credentials are created via
v3/credentials.

Change-Id: I8443d30dffed4201b46d10cef6a0bb43ccdcddc1
Partial-Bug: #1259584

subject: Refactor context trust_id check to wsgi.Application base class
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-01-16 21:42:01.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/contrib/ec2/controllers.py', 'keystone/common/wsgi.py'], 'message': 'Refactor context trust_id check to wsgi.Application base class

Move the ec2 controller check for a trust_id in the token

This function can be used by both v2 and v3 controllers

Test coverage for this is provided via existing tests in

Change-Id: I6028a2cfa0e9e2e16acc99b5a0a027cd6cc42ada

commit_message:
Refactor context trust_id check to wsgi.Application base class

Move the ec2 controller check for a trust_id in the token
specified in the request context, renaming it to match the
existing convention in the controller base classes.

This function can be used by both v2 and v3 controllers
hence putting it into the common Application base class.

Test coverage for this is provided via existing tests in
test_keystoneclient_sql.py

Change-Id: I6028a2cfa0e9e2e16acc99b5a0a027cd6cc42ada
Partial-Bug: #1259584

commit_message:
Remove version from setup.cfg

This will be generated dynamically from git tags instead of being
hardwritten into the setup.cfg.

commit_message:
Listing collections may return incomplete data

A particular deployment might limit the number of entries listing a
collection may return.  In such a sitation, the API will still return
a 200 status code, but set the 'truncated' attribute in the collection to
indicated that not all the entries could be provided.

Partially implements bp list-limiting

Change-Id: I7352faa7ff345e5768cdd84ff0d6ca3530bffb48

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2014-01-13 09:32:15.000000000', 'files': ['troveclient/v1/shell.py'], 'message': 'Adds volume_used to trove show <instance>

Reasons:
- There are two attributes coming from trove related to volume
  attached, total size of volume and used space of volume.
- Used space is an important attribute for a user, it would help to
  plan the resize of volume before the attached volume gets finished.

Changes:
- Adds display of used volume attribut, with "trove show" command.
- Avoids display in dicts-form.
- do_show method now displays total space, and used space for the
  atttached volume, as

    |       status      |                ACTIVE                |
    |      updated      |         2014-01-12T22:17:20          |
    |       volume      |                  1                   |
    |    volume_used    |                 0.13                 |
    +-------------------+--------------------------------------+

Change-Id: I64bddd167c1645077854bd74185886bb45fc69a0
Closes-Bug: #1265144
'}]
commit_message:
Adds volume_used to trove show <instance>

Reasons:
- There are two attributes coming from trove related to volume
  attached, total size of volume and used space of volume.
- Used space is an important attribute for a user, it would help to
  plan the resize of volume before the attached volume gets finished.

Changes:
- Adds display of used volume attribut, with "trove show" command.
- Avoids display in dicts-form.
- do_show method now displays total space, and used space for the
  atttached volume, as

    |       status      |                ACTIVE                |
    |      updated      |         2014-01-12T22:17:20          |
    |       volume      |                  1                   |
    |    volume_used    |                 0.13                 |
    +-------------------+--------------------------------------+

Change-Id: I64bddd167c1645077854bd74185886bb45fc69a0
Closes-Bug: #1265144

commit_message:
Add support for Red Hat Satellite

A Red Hat Satellite URL may be provided as the source for
Red Hat packages. A Satellite key may be provided for a pre-
defined set of RHN channels to be automatically applied. Support
for installation of a Satellite certificate also provided.

Change-Id: Iae5b97d6f4732a28efa08ab778a56c2f9b6b6bd9

subject: Support list of Red Hat channels and repos
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-01-21 19:27:13.000000000', 'files': ['elements/rhel/pre-install.d/00-rhsm', 'elements/rhel/README.md'], 'message': 'Support list of Red Hat channels and repos

When registering to RHN or RHSM a list of space-separated
channels or repositories may be provided. This allows control
over which packages are available to the system during build.
Note, the optional channel or repository is added by default
since diskimage-builder requires access to its packages. This
list is for additional channels or repos.

Change-Id: I9cf90d47ab1d09f5491f574132410438f9e294e3
'}]
commit_message:
Support list of Red Hat channels and repos

When registering to RHN or RHSM a list of space-separated
channels or repositories may be provided. This allows control
over which packages are available to the system during build.
Note, the optional channel or repository is added by default
since diskimage-builder requires access to its packages. This
list is for additional channels or repos.

Change-Id: I9cf90d47ab1d09f5491f574132410438f9e294e3

subject: Add support Red Hat Network (RHN)
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-01-21 19:27:13.000000000', 'files': ['elements/rhel/pre-install.d/00-rhsm', 'elements/rhel/README.md', 'elements/rhel/finalise.d/60-rhsm-unregister'], 'message': 'Add support Red Hat Network (RHN)

This provides basic support to register to the Red Hat Network
(RHN Classic) for packages. The image is unregistered from RHN
before completing image build. The rhnsd service is prevented
from starting since it is not needed for packagage install.

Change-Id: I2dc124cdc6ae59a63fd94d82d77108acccc3f668
'}]
commit_message:
Add support Red Hat Network (RHN)

This provides basic support to register to the Red Hat Network
(RHN Classic) for packages. The image is unregistered from RHN
before completing image build. The rhnsd service is prevented
from starting since it is not needed for packagage install.

Change-Id: I2dc124cdc6ae59a63fd94d82d77108acccc3f668

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2014-01-21 02:55:28.000000000', 'files': ['designate/tests/__init__.py', 'designate/api/v2/controllers/tlds.py', 'designate/storage/impl_sqlalchemy/migrate_repo/versions/037_add_tlds_table.py', 'designate/tests/test_central/test_service.py', 'designate/storage/api.py', 'designate/central/rpcapi.py', 'designate/exceptions.py', 'doc/source/examples/basic-config-sample.conf', 'designate/tests/test_api/test_v2/test_tlds.py', 'designate/api/v2/controllers/root.py', 'designate/storage/impl_sqlalchemy/__init__.py', 'designate/resources/schemas/v2/tlds.json', 'designate/central/effectivetld.py', 'etc/designate/policy.json', 'etc/designate/effective_tld_names.dat.sample', 'designate/central/service.py', 'etc/designate/designate.conf.sample', 'designate/storage/base.py', 'designate/storage/impl_sqlalchemy/models.py', 'designate/resources/schemas/v2/tld.json', 'designate/tests/test_api/test_v2/test_zones.py', 'designate/central/__init__.py', 'designate/schema/format.py', 'etc/designate/tlds-alpha-by-domain.txt.sample', 'designate/api/v2/views/tlds.py'], 'message': "Add APIs for managing TLDs

This change adds APIs for managing TLDs. Previously TLDs were in
2 files. With this change, the TLDs will be in the central's storage
database.

When the service starts for the first time, by default there are no
TLDs in the database.  When there are no TLDs in the database
the behavior is to not check for TLDs when creating domains.
Once a TLD is created in the database, the TLD checks are
enforced.

Change-Id: Ibc945af3b158355475f5c8ee7887ed4b32081337
"}]
commit_message:
Add APIs for managing TLDs

This change adds APIs for managing TLDs. Previously TLDs were in
2 files. With this change, the TLDs will be in the central's storage
database.

When the service starts for the first time, by default there are no
TLDs in the database.  When there are no TLDs in the database
the behavior is to not check for TLDs when creating domains.
Once a TLD is created in the database, the TLD checks are
enforced.

Change-Id: Ibc945af3b158355475f5c8ee7887ed4b32081337

commit_message:
Move cinder iptables rules into scoped elements

This patch moves the iptables rules for the cinder-api
and cinder-volume nodes to the appropriate element.

This patch also moves the volume resize logic from the
cinder element into the cinder-volume element.

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-01-22 10:56:14.000000000', 'files': ['attributes/default.rb', 'spec/database_spec.rb'], 'message': "Fix issue: Access denied when access mysql database

The mysqld installed by default database cookbook do not allowed
to access by user 'root'@'127.0.0.1' (using password: YES), so
change 127.0.0.1 to localhost.

Change-Id: I870b112e57d2d10bf662d37bf664fa9f7616387f
Closes-Bug: #1271486
"}]
commit_message:
Fix issue: Access denied when access mysql database

The mysqld installed by default database cookbook do not allowed
to access by user 'root'@'127.0.0.1' (using password: YES), so
change 127.0.0.1 to localhost.

Change-Id: I870b112e57d2d10bf662d37bf664fa9f7616387f
Closes-Bug: #1271486

commit_message:
Convert alarm timestamp to PrecisionTimestamp

Before the timestamps for alarm are stored in a datetime
In mysql, datetimes have only second precision, and the datetimes are
rounded.

This patch, change the Datetime by the PrecisionTimestamp Column Type, like
the sample and the event timestamps that demand the same precision.

Change-Id: Iad10c621b276fc40b9965d01bc460bcc834b473a

commit_message:
Use DEFAULT section for dispatcher in doc

Section of dispatcher is moved to DEFAULT in Icehouse, it is in
collector section in Havana but already deprecated. The
doc/source/install/manual.rst still put it in collector section
which seems not good.

Change-Id: I2c5c16c2ffe0dabd19966fc79ad88e418a43a6fd
Closes-Bug: #1269521

commit_message:
Make availability_zone optional in create for aggregates

As the novaclient's help message, we can create aggregate without
availability_zone. But the api didn't allow it, so this patch make
it optional.

Closes-bug: 1252177

DocImpact

Change-Id: I64629d71648900bf5be554d9afa4ae47d6b651d0

commit_message:
Remove vim headers

We don't need to have the vim headers in each source files. We can set
it in our vimrc file instead. Also if set incorrectly, gate (pep8 check)
will catch the mistakes.

More discussions:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2013-October/017353.html

Change-Id: I43703e2289212389c7841f44691ae7849ed1f505
Closes-Bug: #1229324

commit_message:
Fix to handle null threshold_rule values

check if threshold_rule and combination_rule values
are None and raise the right error in the validation
method instead of propagating it further causing
unhandled exceptions.

fixes bug #1238453

Change-Id: I70a397c89d974e489fd0ccc4ab28d73aed51443f

revisions:
[{'number': 23, 'created': '2014-01-16 09:01:38.000000000', 'files': ['tests/test_types.py', 'oslo/config/cfg.py', 'oslo/config/types.py', 'tests/test_cfg.py'], 'message': "Implemented support for custom opt types

Motivation:

Currently oslo.config supports only basic set of types:
strings, integers, floats, booleans, lists of strings and
dictionaries of strings. The reason of existence of types
other than string is to provide some kind of value
validation (e.g. that integer contains only digits).
There is a demand in community to have more complex value
checks, e.g. that a port configuration option contains
integer value that fits in certain range, host ip address
conforms to ip address format, etc.

Solution:

This patch introduces support for custom Opt types that
will allow a better control of value conversion and
validation. Custom types are presented as type
constructors - callable objects that take a string and
either return converted value or raise ValueError in
case value can't be converted. This concept is similar to
argument types in 'argparse' library.
Type constructor can be a class which instances are
callable, a function or any callable object (which allows
usage of parametriezed type class instances).

Details:

Oslo.config has Opt subclasses that control value
conversion and validation: StrOpt, IntOpt, FloatOpt, etc.
The type information is added to the base class - Opt -
cause otherwise it would introduce confusion on what class
to use when introducing e.g. NetworkPort: StrOpt or IntOpt.
For each existing Opt subclass a corresponding type was
implemented (see oslo.config.types).  StrOpt, IntOpt, etc.
classes are left for backward compatibility and present an
Opt class parametrized with particular type.

There are two exceptions of this rule: BoolOpt and
MultiStrOpt. Those classes define a special logic for
parsing values. BoolOpt was left unchanged and should be
used when someone wants a Boolean option that is available
through CLI.
MultiStrOpt has logic to accumulate values. As it was bound
to String type only, it's logic was extracted into a
MultiOpt class and MultiStrOpt was left as a subclass
parametrized with String type.

Opt values allow value substitution. Previously it worked
only for string types but now this feature only makes sense
if it would work on any type. _substitute() and _do_get()
methods of ConfigOpts class were updated to cover that.
Also, TemplateSubstitution tests were updated to ensure
that substitution is done before type conversion kicks in
or otherwise type conversion will fail (e.g. if Integer
type converted will get something like '$listen_port').

Advised review steps:

1. New type classes (oslo/config/types.py) and their tests
   (tests/test_types.py);
2. Changes to Str/Bool/Int/etc-Opt classes
   (those are pretty straight forward);
3. Other changes that add support for new types into
   existing infrastructure;
4. New cfg test cases added (mostly related to changes in
   substitution mechanics).

blueprint oslo-config-options-validation

Change-Id: I6910f1efa540cfe757b2be6da0aec072f8ed28fa
"}]
commit_message:
Implemented support for custom opt types

Motivation:

Currently oslo.config supports only basic set of types:
strings, integers, floats, booleans, lists of strings and
dictionaries of strings. The reason of existence of types
other than string is to provide some kind of value
validation (e.g. that integer contains only digits).
There is a demand in community to have more complex value
checks, e.g. that a port configuration option contains
integer value that fits in certain range, host ip address
conforms to ip address format, etc.

Solution:

This patch introduces support for custom Opt types that
will allow a better control of value conversion and
validation. Custom types are presented as type
constructors - callable objects that take a string and
either return converted value or raise ValueError in
case value can't be converted. This concept is similar to
argument types in 'argparse' library.
Type constructor can be a class which instances are
callable, a function or any callable object (which allows
usage of parametriezed type class instances).

Details:

Oslo.config has Opt subclasses that control value
conversion and validation: StrOpt, IntOpt, FloatOpt, etc.
The type information is added to the base class - Opt -
cause otherwise it would introduce confusion on what class
to use when introducing e.g. NetworkPort: StrOpt or IntOpt.
For each existing Opt subclass a corresponding type was
implemented (see oslo.config.types).  StrOpt, IntOpt, etc.
classes are left for backward compatibility and present an
Opt class parametrized with particular type.

There are two exceptions of this rule: BoolOpt and
MultiStrOpt. Those classes define a special logic for
parsing values. BoolOpt was left unchanged and should be
used when someone wants a Boolean option that is available
through CLI.
MultiStrOpt has logic to accumulate values. As it was bound
to String type only, it's logic was extracted into a
MultiOpt class and MultiStrOpt was left as a subclass
parametrized with String type.

Opt values allow value substitution. Previously it worked
only for string types but now this feature only makes sense
if it would work on any type. _substitute() and _do_get()
methods of ConfigOpts class were updated to cover that.
Also, TemplateSubstitution tests were updated to ensure
that substitution is done before type conversion kicks in
or otherwise type conversion will fail (e.g. if Integer
type converted will get something like '$listen_port').

Advised review steps:

1. New type classes (oslo/config/types.py) and their tests
   (tests/test_types.py);
2. Changes to Str/Bool/Int/etc-Opt classes
   (those are pretty straight forward);
3. Other changes that add support for new types into
   existing infrastructure;
4. New cfg test cases added (mostly related to changes in
   substitution mechanics).

blueprint oslo-config-options-validation

Change-Id: I6910f1efa540cfe757b2be6da0aec072f8ed28fa

python3: Switch to mox3 instead of mox

In order to transition to a python 3.x compatible world,
lets switch to mox3 which is python 3.x compatible drop-in
replacement of mox.

commit_message:
Update oslo

This updates Oslo to the latest commit
997ab2776c9cad033234e28a92fb7bc0ef5bc4c0

It removes the test_service test file, as the behavior of restarting on
SIGHUP is dependent of openstack.common.service which has changed
recently, is already tested as part of oslo.incubator's tests.

Change-Id: I389c690f4febe9c69c1e2c39cd16961635469c75

This allows tests/benchmarks from the instance perspective, as well as

blueprint benchmark-scenarios

Change-Id: I4b1f77f5f8c55fe1da41b6ab0b23eb03303ba95f

commit_message:
Benchmark scenarios for Rally: run task in instance

This patch allows a user to define a scenario where Nova instances are
created, then a script which outputs arbitrary JSON is run, and then the
instance is destroyed.

This allows tests/benchmarks from the instance perspective, as well as
from OS APIs.

blueprint benchmark-scenarios

Change-Id: I4b1f77f5f8c55fe1da41b6ab0b23eb03303ba95f

Change-Id: Ib53ac9903b9645220f62225ffa774e9ceb8dd9f2

commit_message:
Add openssh-server to install-dependencies

This change adds openssh-server as an install dependency for ubuntu and
rhel. This is required for the virtual power manager in the seed vm to
ssh into the host machine.

Change-Id: Ib53ac9903b9645220f62225ffa774e9ceb8dd9f2
