reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 8053, 'name': 'Nikolay Markov', 'email': 'nmarkov@mirantis.com', 'username': 'NikolayMarkov'}, {'_account_id': 8392, 'name': 'Aleksey Kasatkin', 'email': 'akasatkin@mirantis.com', 'username': 'aleksey'}, {'_account_id': 8749, 'name': 'Evgeniy L', 'email': 'eli@mirantis.com', 'username': 'evgeniyl'}, {'_account_id': 8935, 'name': 'Andrey Danin', 'email': 'gcon.monolake@gmail.com', 'username': 'adanin'}, {'_account_id': 8971, 'name': 'Fuel CI', 'username': 'fuel-ci', 'inactive': True, 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2014-01-17 13:30:20.000000000', 'files': ['nailgun/nailgun/network/neutron.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/network/nova_network.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/test/integration/test_node_nic_assignment.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/test/integration/test_network_validation.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/test/integration/test_verify_networks_task_manager.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/fixtures/openstack.json', 'nailgun/nailgun/test/integration/test_cluster_changes_handler.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/network/manager.py'], 'message': 'Flexible networks-to-nics assignment

Networks-to-nics assignment is now sensitive to current networking configuration of target cluster.
Default assignment in case of Nova-Network is changed because the current algorithm tries to map
as more as possible networks to each NIC
instead of fixed mapping to non-admin NIC of all remaining networks as it was done before.
Tests added.

Closes-Bug: #1262149

Change-Id: Idd62f124b0f12ac10f3b542cdb05a476ec36cfec
'}]
commit_message:
Flexible networks-to-nics assignment

Networks-to-nics assignment is now sensitive to current networking configuration of target cluster.
Default assignment in case of Nova-Network is changed because the current algorithm tries to map
as more as possible networks to each NIC
instead of fixed mapping to non-admin NIC of all remaining networks as it was done before.
Tests added.

Closes-Bug: #1262149

Change-Id: Idd62f124b0f12ac10f3b542cdb05a476ec36cfec

subject: Integration of JSHint checks into Jasmine tests
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2013-12-12 14:02:31.000000000', 'files': ['horizon/static/horizon/lib/qhint.js', 'horizon/templates/horizon/qunit.html', 'horizon/test/jasmine/jasmine.py', 'horizon/test/helpers.py', 'horizon/static/horizon/tests/jshint.js', 'horizon/static/horizon/tests/jasmine/jsHintSpec.js'], 'message': 'Integration of JSHint checks into Jasmine tests

    JSHint tests are now wrapped into Jasmines tests, the file
/horizon/static/horizon/tests/jasmine/jsHintSpec.js contains the jshint
configuration and a JSLINT_MAX_ERRORS variable which indicates the number
of JSHint errors to log. All errors are logged through Selenium and can
be retrieved on the server side.
    The use of this wrapper allow us to remove the qhint.js dependency.
All tests can load a js file and test it asynchronously (through
Angular $http service).

Change-Id: I39e01dcc2acc76ad3cd5d3a44c32d6a4aeeb7faf
'}]
commit_message:
Integration of JSHint checks into Jasmine tests

    JSHint tests are now wrapped into Jasmines tests, the file
/horizon/static/horizon/tests/jasmine/jsHintSpec.js contains the jshint
configuration and a JSLINT_MAX_ERRORS variable which indicates the number
of JSHint errors to log. All errors are logged through Selenium and can
be retrieved on the server side.
    The use of this wrapper allow us to remove the qhint.js dependency.
All tests can load a js file and test it asynchronously (through
Angular $http service).

Change-Id: I39e01dcc2acc76ad3cd5d3a44c32d6a4aeeb7faf

commit_message:
Implement the /v2/samples/<sample-id> API

This is a simple implementation of the new sample endpoint in the API.
It provides raw accesses to the samples collected by Ceilometer, without
imposing any kind of filtering on the meter name.

The patch is about retreiving only one sample with the id.

The fields are also correctly named this time.

Change-Id: Ifdd7f024b066407cd42ec0572385f97acd312125
Blueprint: sample-api

commit_message:
Add token create subcommand for identity v2 api

Implements token create subcommand which is an equivalent of keystone
token-get command. Original "wrap" parameter for keystone token-get is
not implemented yet due to cliff Bug #1269299

This is a part of: blueprint add-identity-token-support

Change-Id: I9e4de93306f2f5959717b5219621da03961524d8

commit_message:
Datastores improvements

List of improvements:
- added default_version field in datastore show output
- admin can list deactivated versions too
- admin can see extanded info about datastore version (image_id, packages)
- add possibility to retrive version by uuid (without specified datastore)

Implements: blueprint datastore-type-version-followon

Change-Id: I9b0c3547fb6a881a01db9e6e3d8d72077bc5ee29

subject: Add management of unauthorized keystone exceptions
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-01-21 15:45:35.000000000', 'files': ['rally/exceptions.py', 'rally/cmd/main.py', 'tests/benchmark/test_engine.py', 'rally/benchmark/engine.py', 'rally/deploy/engine.py'], 'message': 'Add management of unauthorized keystone exceptions

  * Raise InvalidEnpointsException if the endpoint properties are wrong
  * Raise InvalidAdminException if the user is not admin
  * Print a specific message to the user if they are in this case
  * Remove the stacktrace if the user encounter a InvalidArgumentException

Change-Id: I4659795924de57de1a58cec42f0d58c34b81c661
Closes-Bug: #1270209
'}]
commit_message:
Add management of unauthorized keystone exceptions

  * Raise InvalidEnpointsException if the endpoint properties are wrong
  * Raise InvalidAdminException if the user is not admin
  * Print a specific message to the user if they are in this case
  * Remove the stacktrace if the user encounter a InvalidArgumentException

Change-Id: I4659795924de57de1a58cec42f0d58c34b81c661
Closes-Bug: #1270209

We should check whether the resource number exceeded the limit on
validate_template() and return error if exceeded.

Closes-Bug: #1266394

commit_message:
libvirt: enabling svirt for lxc instances

Enabling dynamic svirt setting for LXC instances.
Users will also be able to set a base security label.
The actuall driver's baselabel will be generated from it.
Ex.
svirt_baselabel='system_u:system_r:my_svirt_t:s0'

DocImpact
Implements: blueprint libvirt-enable-lxc-svirt
Change-Id: I3a07ce15293f3a438bff50eb968d355256852c43

subject: Require colander
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-01-13 15:31:53.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt'], 'message': "Require colander

Colander is a schema validation library that is going to be used in the
future as part of oslo.messaging schema validation, and probably other
part like API data type validations.

It is actively maintained by the Pylons project, and supports Python 3.
So far there's already proof of backward compatibility even if the
version is still beta.

Change-Id: I797becc37c00f45e6d878860517f42831d910fb8
"}]
commit_message:
Require colander

Colander is a schema validation library that is going to be used in the
future as part of oslo.messaging schema validation, and probably other
part like API data type validations.

It is actively maintained by the Pylons project, and supports Python 3.
So far there's already proof of backward compatibility even if the
version is still beta.

Change-Id: I797becc37c00f45e6d878860517f42831d910fb8

subject: Support compare objects in test cases
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-01-14 21:31:39.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/objects/test_objects.py'], 'message': "Support compare objects in test cases

Currently in the objects test case, it mainly compare an object
to the dict object for make sure the NovaObject is correct. However,
in some situation, the test case may want to compare two NovaObjects,
like when the NovaObject does complex conversion from the db object.

There are two method to achieve this. One is to extend the NovaObject
to support compare, but it's probably overkill for this purpose. Another
one is to enhance the compare_obj to support not only compare with db_obj,
but also another NovaObject.

Change-Id: Ic164ae1c355ea00b75c29d51f859ab21c695f522
Signed-off-by: Yunhong Jiang <yunhong.jiang@intel.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Support compare objects in test cases

Currently in the objects test case, it mainly compare an object
to the dict object for make sure the NovaObject is correct. However,
in some situation, the test case may want to compare two NovaObjects,
like when the NovaObject does complex conversion from the db object.

There are two method to achieve this. One is to extend the NovaObject
to support compare, but it's probably overkill for this purpose. Another
one is to enhance the compare_obj to support not only compare with db_obj,
but also another NovaObject.

Change-Id: Ic164ae1c355ea00b75c29d51f859ab21c695f522
Signed-off-by: Yunhong Jiang <yunhong.jiang@intel.com>

commit_message:
Raise traceback on error when using CLI and -debug

When --debug is specified to the CLI don't just print the simple error
message but actually reraise that error.

Closes-Bug: #1268202

commit_message:
Refactor MySQL long text support

Seperate Json into two classes: LongText and Json. So type LongText
can be reused in both models and migration, for example, reused by
software config model(config).

Change-Id: If6a8f77e656ad17ee465cb4724d5e28962c0efef

commit_message:
Fix incorrect resource types in docs/comment/code

The template guide documentation references OS::Compute::Server in several
places, and there are similar errors in the environment code comments and
environment test code. Also there is a similar issue with template guide
reference to Rackspace::Compute::Server, and a minor typo/spelling issue.

Change-Id: Iafbf405a328bdd8222c277efe5b52d7f8f589635

commit_message:
Turn block_device_mapping.volume_size to int

Integer instead of string will allow better constrain implementation
plus Nova expects such parameter to be an integer.

This change is backward compatible, as it still accepts string values.

Change-Id: I599ea2bf77a187cc53f864a9e1a42755142211ff
Closes-Bug: #1267889

commit_message:
Consolidate user visible spelling of keypair vs Key Pair

"Key Pair" wins the Google popularity contest (880k vs 300k),
and "Keypair" is not listed in Webster. Ispell autocorrects
it to "Key Pair" (or Key-Pair)

Change-Id: I4710b194dfd3c53f21fc99ce53db94cc5af0c158
Related-Bug: #1210533

commit_message:
Add code to configure cluster for external hdfs

* Validation for hdfs data sources in data_source.py
* "hdfs" data source type in base.py
* Function configure_cluster_for_hdfs in hdfs_helper.py
* Fixed job_manager.py to account for hdfs data sources

blueprint epd-data-source-existing-hadoop-cluster

Co-Authored-By: Alexander Kuznetsov <akuznetsov@mirantis.com>
Co-Authored-By: Sergey Reshetnyak <sreshetniak@mirantis.com>

Change-Id: I4def592c3e0c8d2ffcb3d0f958504bb10bbb3407

commit_message:
Add explicit start to vncproxy_service

This change adds an explicit start to vncproxy_service.  I've also
updated the spec tests for vncproxy recipe to test that this service
gets started, while also adding some missing tests for RHEL.

Change-Id: Icb8c043bc5c7ac3f97e6f9ae253bd0f748c3ebd6
Closes-Bug: #1256460

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-01-21 17:00:00.000000000', 'files': ['marconi/queues/storage/mongodb/utils.py'], 'message': "fix: ConnectionError no longer takes positional arguments

When storage.errors was modified to DRY up message formatting, one
line in the mongodb driver wasn't updated accordingly. This patch
updates that code so that the gate will stop breaking when it tests
against the mongodb driver.

Change-Id: I9552b2dfc2fa767815d6278eb3bc918099603c63
"}]
commit_message:
fix: ConnectionError no longer takes positional arguments

When storage.errors was modified to DRY up message formatting, one
line in the mongodb driver wasn't updated accordingly. This patch
updates that code so that the gate will stop breaking when it tests
against the mongodb driver.

Change-Id: I9552b2dfc2fa767815d6278eb3bc918099603c63

subject: Permit deploying an overcloud with SSL endpoints.
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2014-01-17 17:35:24.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/init-keystone', 'scripts/devtest_overcloud.sh', 'scripts/setup-endpoints'], 'message': "Permit deploying an overcloud with SSL endpoints.

SSL is a key feature in todays environment. This patch matches what
Chris Jones did by hand for the currrent cd-undercloud - it may well
be something we evolve in future.

Some services are not yet running with SSL configuration, I've
commented around them appropriately and we can iterate on making them
work.

Change-Id: I511d5f5a3bad3169fc1b61dce5d3d055f1cd5960
"}]
commit_message:
Permit deploying an overcloud with SSL endpoints.

SSL is a key feature in todays environment. This patch matches what
Chris Jones did by hand for the currrent cd-undercloud - it may well
be something we evolve in future.

Some services are not yet running with SSL configuration, I've
commented around them appropriately and we can iterate on making them
work.

Change-Id: I511d5f5a3bad3169fc1b61dce5d3d055f1cd5960

subject: Add SSL configuration metadata for overclouds.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-01-17 01:19:05.000000000', 'files': ['Makefile', 'ssl-source.yaml'], 'message': "Add SSL configuration metadata for overclouds.

This passes SSL keys in via Heat which places a high cost on heat
compromises or the use of a non-SSL heat to do deploys. We'll want
to ensure that that is documented clearly.

Change-Id: I14d441460116fda91fbd1d2097c5598b57155a6d
"}]
commit_message:
Add SSL configuration metadata for overclouds.

This passes SSL keys in via Heat which places a high cost on heat
compromises or the use of a non-SSL heat to do deploys. We'll want
to ensure that that is documented clearly.

commit_message:
Allow multiple volume delete from cli like Cinder

In cinder project, we can use cli like follow:
cinder delete xxx yyy zzz
But in nova, we can not use follow command:
nova volume-delete xxx yyy zzz

This patch will add a feature in nova to allow multiple volume
delete from cli like cinder.

Change-Id: I4dd182673e58406a57d30c572ec3116f9f4ce315
Closes-Bug: #1262061

subject: Allow user to specify audit period.
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2014-01-17 09:26:22.000000000', 'files': ['bin/cinder-volume-usage-audit'], 'message': "Allow user to specify audit period.

The script 'cinder-volume-usage-audit' is generally run by cron to
generate volume and snapshot exists audit notifications that can be
consumed by ceilometer or other auditing systems. In this mode it sends
notifications for volumes that existed in the 'last completed audit
period' as calculated by cinder.utils.last_completed_audit_period()

However, it may sometimes be necessary to be able to send notifications
for audit periods other than than the last completed audit period. For
example if the host running the audit script was down for a period.

This patch provides three optional command line parameters to the script
cinder-volume-usage-audit. If no parameters are provided then the
operation of the script is unchanged. If parameters are provided then
they have the following effects:

--start_time specifies a date and time that is used in place of the
start of the last completed audit period.

--end_time specifies a date and time that is used in place of the end of
the last completed audit period.

--send_actions As well as sending exits notifications the script will
send any create or delete notifications that would have been sent during
the specified audit period.

Closes-Bug: #1259147

Change-Id: I0cfe963ea59d811ba4bac0bd3de31382a088b8c8
"}]
commit_message:
Allow user to specify audit period.

The script 'cinder-volume-usage-audit' is generally run by cron to
generate volume and snapshot exists audit notifications that can be
consumed by ceilometer or other auditing systems. In this mode it sends
notifications for volumes that existed in the 'last completed audit
period' as calculated by cinder.utils.last_completed_audit_period()

However, it may sometimes be necessary to be able to send notifications
for audit periods other than than the last completed audit period. For
example if the host running the audit script was down for a period.

This patch provides three optional command line parameters to the script
cinder-volume-usage-audit. If no parameters are provided then the
operation of the script is unchanged. If parameters are provided then
they have the following effects:

--start_time specifies a date and time that is used in place of the
start of the last completed audit period.

--end_time specifies a date and time that is used in place of the end of
the last completed audit period.

--send_actions As well as sending exits notifications the script will
send any create or delete notifications that would have been sent during
the specified audit period.

Closes-Bug: #1259147

Change-Id: I0cfe963ea59d811ba4bac0bd3de31382a088b8c8

commit_message:
Transfer creation doesn't support 'name' via xml

Change the transfer create XML deserializer to use 'name' rather than
'display_name'. This is in line with cinderclient and the json code.

Closes-Bug: #1243613

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-01-10 15:38:28.000000000', 'files': ['tests/test_shell.py'], 'message': 'Replace file.write and os.path.exists by mock

During the test files may be lost in the temporary directory.
Therefore, it would be nice if we reduce dependence of temporary directory.

This patch replace buildin method file.write by mock in ShellCacheSchemaTest.
Also we need to replace method os.path.exists by mock to correct all checks.

Fixes bug: #1267515

Change-Id: I3faca27348e15b28619e49f11d0d6cff5a9e2906
'}]
commit_message:
Replace file.write and os.path.exists by mock

During the test files may be lost in the temporary directory.
Therefore, it would be nice if we reduce dependence of temporary directory.

This patch replace buildin method file.write by mock in ShellCacheSchemaTest.
Also we need to replace method os.path.exists by mock to correct all checks.

Fixes bug: #1267515

Change-Id: I3faca27348e15b28619e49f11d0d6cff5a9e2906

subject: Fix cross-import bug in cinder.db.sqlalchemy.api
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-01-15 13:01:34.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/db/api.py', 'cinder/exception.py', 'cinder/db/sqlalchemy/api.py', 'cinder/tests/test_db_api.py'], 'message': 'Fix cross-import bug in cinder.db.sqlalchemy.api

Cross import in cinder.sqlalchemy.db.api module breaks
if lazy loading of db backend is removed

In oslo.incubator db.api lazy loading was removed

commit_message:
Fix cross-import bug in cinder.db.sqlalchemy.api

Cross import in cinder.sqlalchemy.db.api module breaks
if lazy loading of db backend is removed

In oslo.incubator db.api lazy loading was removed
Check this change for details https://review.openstack.org/#/c/55985/

Change-Id: I6a75afd0b9b55097ef76ad24c53e84339b527196

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-01-21 15:55:57.000000000', 'files': ['savanna/service/edp/workflow_creator/workflow_factory.py', 'savanna/tests/unit/service/edp/test_job_manager.py'], 'message': 'Read Swift credentials from input_data OR output_data

Fix the workflow generation so that Swift username and password
configuration values can be automatically generated from the
input data source or the output data source.  Previously, only
the input data source was considered.  With the addition of
other storage technologies for data sources, it is possible that
only one or the other is in Swift.

Closes-Bug: #1270201

Change-Id: I61434fe658dd6bf30133947f910cfca00fe0e6ca
'}]
commit_message:
Read Swift credentials from input_data OR output_data

Fix the workflow generation so that Swift username and password
configuration values can be automatically generated from the
input data source or the output data source.  Previously, only
the input data source was considered.  With the addition of
other storage technologies for data sources, it is possible that
only one or the other is in Swift.

Closes-Bug: #1270201

Change-Id: I61434fe658dd6bf30133947f910cfca00fe0e6ca

subject: Remove env from rootwrap filter
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-01-17 16:52:14.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/brick/local_dev/lvm.py', 'etc/cinder/rootwrap.d/volume.filters', 'cinder/tests/brick/test_brick_lvm.py'], 'message': "Remove env from rootwrap filter

Allowing 'env' as a CommandFilter is similar to
allowing '/bin/bash', which makes all of rootwrap pointless.
Use EnvFilter instead. Change corresponding commands
that use env for setting C locale and adjust rootwrap
filters accordingly.

Several commands that output information that is
parsed as input by cinder change their behavior
based on the environment locale, which is depending
on local system settings. The code is however only
able to parse in C locale, so enforce that one.

Closes-Bug: #1269958

Change-Id: Ie1463e608c80204c7a8906efb95899a66aa733da
"}]
commit_message:
Remove env from rootwrap filter

Allowing 'env' as a CommandFilter is similar to
allowing '/bin/bash', which makes all of rootwrap pointless.
Use EnvFilter instead. Change corresponding commands
that use env for setting C locale and adjust rootwrap
filters accordingly.

Several commands that output information that is
parsed as input by cinder change their behavior
based on the environment locale, which is depending
on local system settings. The code is however only
able to parse in C locale, so enforce that one.

Closes-Bug: #1269958

Change-Id: Ie1463e608c80204c7a8906efb95899a66aa733da

subject: Adjust unit tests to clarify existing device usage
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-01-10 16:06:43.000000000', 'files': ['test/unit/obj/test_diskfile.py'], 'message': 'Adjust unit tests to clarify existing device usage

Most of the unit tests run with check_mount=False, so if a device is
chosen by a test that was not created ahead of time, the test will still
work, since the "tmp" directory creation in DiskFile.create() using
mkdirs(), thereby creating the a directory for the device (perhaps that
should be fixed).

This change refactors the test code to use the exiting device
explicitly.

Change-Id: Ib4fbf069596672bb0b98f41573f312eabde38f98
'}]
commit_message:
Adjust unit tests to clarify existing device usage

Most of the unit tests run with check_mount=False, so if a device is
chosen by a test that was not created ahead of time, the test will still
work, since the "tmp" directory creation in DiskFile.create() using
mkdirs(), thereby creating the a directory for the device (perhaps that
should be fixed).

This change refactors the test code to use the exiting device
explicitly.

Change-Id: Ib4fbf069596672bb0b98f41573f312eabde38f98

subject: Filter DB queries per project_id
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2014-01-21 16:21:57.000000000', 'files': ['climate/api/context.py', 'climate/context.py', 'climate/manager/service.py', 'climate/tests/db/sqlalchemy/test_sqlalchemy_api.py', 'climate/db/sqlalchemy/models.py', 'climate/tests/api/test_context.py', 'climate/tests/test_context.py', 'climate/db/sqlalchemy/api.py'], 'message': "Filter DB queries per project_id

Currently, DB queries don't filter on project_id, so any user can
request all DB entries.

The proposal here is to filter if the table does support tenant_id
in it and if the user is not admin (based on Nova/Cinder/Oslo)

In order to automatically provide the correct is_admin flag, now
when creating the context we check if policy defines the user as
admin.

Closes-Bug: #1256117

Change-Id: I85c404f5a3365c6a9c575af52f1a116f8350f426
"}]
commit_message:
Filter DB queries per project_id

Currently, DB queries don't filter on project_id, so any user can
request all DB entries.

The proposal here is to filter if the table does support tenant_id
in it and if the user is not admin (based on Nova/Cinder/Oslo)

In order to automatically provide the correct is_admin flag, now
when creating the context we check if policy defines the user as
admin.

Closes-Bug: #1256117

Change-Id: I85c404f5a3365c6a9c575af52f1a116f8350f426

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-01-06 17:11:14.000000000', 'files': ['trove/instance/views.py', 'etc/trove/trove-taskmanager.conf.sample', 'trove/dns/manager.py', 'trove/taskmanager/models.py'], 'message': 'Make use of IP filtering when creating DNS records

Previously, the return list from get_ip_address in
trove.instance.views was not filtering by the CONF.ip_regex.
(See blueprint add-ip-addr-filter-to-instance-view for more
information). DNS uses this method to get the IP. Therefore
it was not creating record with the right IP. Moving the filtering
logic to the get_ip_address method will ensure that both DNS and
instance view will obtain the right IP.

Change-Id: I4ce7c65e24f6d105f555e6c36d788558daa25f12
Closes-Bug: #1260089
'}]
commit_message:
Make use of IP filtering when creating DNS records

Previously, the return list from get_ip_address in
trove.instance.views was not filtering by the CONF.ip_regex.
(See blueprint add-ip-addr-filter-to-instance-view for more
information). DNS uses this method to get the IP. Therefore
it was not creating record with the right IP. Moving the filtering
logic to the get_ip_address method will ensure that both DNS and
instance view will obtain the right IP.

Change-Id: I4ce7c65e24f6d105f555e6c36d788558daa25f12
Closes-Bug: #1260089

Verify that the filesystem size on the volume increases and is about
the size of the Cinder volume.  This checks for the case where the
Cinder volume device may have increased but the filesystem may not
have been resized thus not representing the actual available volume
size.

Change-Id: I06059cd18ec78085187c4e86ea9288d35ee4a5f6
Implements: blueprint add-volume-total-attribute
'}]
commit_message:
Add Volume Resize filesystem size assertion

Verify that the filesystem size on the volume increases and is about
the size of the Cinder volume.  This checks for the case where the
Cinder volume device may have increased but the filesystem may not
have been resized thus not representing the actual available volume
size.

Change-Id: I06059cd18ec78085187c4e86ea9288d35ee4a5f6
Implements: blueprint add-volume-total-attribute

[{'number': 5, 'created': '2014-01-06 15:30:38.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/conf/test_begin.conf', 'scripts/redstack'], 'message': "Removing keystone account creation

Reasons:
- Currently devstack creates the users 'admin', 'demo', and

  for the integration tests.

Changes:
- Removing custom keystone user creation from redstack.
- Replacing users in test_begin.conf with devstack ones.
- Changed glance, swift, and rd commands to use the openrc
  helper script to log in as 'admin' or 'demo'

Change-Id: I59dd1e94aa40d87d8b69009fbfa2a7205ea822d0
"}]
commit_message:
Removing keystone account creation

Reasons:
- Currently devstack creates the users 'admin', 'demo', and
  'alt_demo' so there is no need to create any extra users
  for the integration tests.

Changes:
- Removing custom keystone user creation from redstack.
- Replacing users in test_begin.conf with devstack ones.
- Changed glance, swift, and rd commands to use the openrc
  helper script to log in as 'admin' or 'demo'
- Changed the report_directory sed line to match the others
  in the mod_test_conf function.

Closes-Bug: #1265829

Change-Id: I59dd1e94aa40d87d8b69009fbfa2a7205ea822d0

commit_message:
Setup test program to use the same config as test runner

This allows for nose plugins to be setup properly
during the test run. So now flags such as '--with-xunit'
will be honored.

[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-01-21 16:24:01.000000000', 'files': ['nova/api/openstack/compute/plugins/v3/servers.py', 'nova/tests/api/openstack/compute/plugins/v3/test_servers.py', 'nova/compute/api.py', 'nova/tests/api/openstack/compute/plugins/v3/test_server_actions.py'], 'message': 'Join pci_devices for servers API

A previous change, 119e2a690a64fdfd541010590285f754b3393653, joined
pci_devices in the v3 servers API when getting a full list of instances.
This was to work around a race condition with the PCI API extension.
When the PCI extension runs later, it lazy-loads pci_devices.  This may
raise InstanceNotFound if the instance was deleted in the meantime.

The last patch did not fully resolve this race condition, as we are also
seeing it rather regularly in API calls for a single server.  This patch
updates the compute_api.get() calls to join pci_devices, as well.

Change-Id: Id3e60c3c56c2eb4209e8aca8a2c26881ca86b435
Closes-bug: #1270680
'}]
commit_message:
Join pci_devices for servers API

A previous change, 119e2a690a64fdfd541010590285f754b3393653, joined
pci_devices in the v3 servers API when getting a full list of instances.
This was to work around a race condition with the PCI API extension.
When the PCI extension runs later, it lazy-loads pci_devices.  This may
raise InstanceNotFound if the instance was deleted in the meantime.

The last patch did not fully resolve this race condition, as we are also
seeing it rather regularly in API calls for a single server.  This patch
updates the compute_api.get() calls to join pci_devices, as well.

Change-Id: Id3e60c3c56c2eb4209e8aca8a2c26881ca86b435
Closes-bug: #1270680

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-01-10 03:38:47.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/tests/conductor/test_manager.py', 'ironic/conductor/manager.py'], 'message': 'sync_power_states handles missing driver info

The ConductorManager._sync_power_states() periodic task will stop
checking power states if getting the power state of a node raises an
exception. Eg, this could happen if a node is not properly configured
(for which node.driver.power.validate() raises an exception).

With this change, sync_power_state catches the exceptions, logs them,
and continues checking other nodes.

Change-Id: I343f722de8f79a50fbaa9fcdd180decdc5a43f95
Closes-Bug: #1262912
'}]
commit_message:
sync_power_states handles missing driver info

The ConductorManager._sync_power_states() periodic task will stop
checking power states if getting the power state of a node raises an
exception. Eg, this could happen if a node is not properly configured
(for which node.driver.power.validate() raises an exception).

With this change, sync_power_state catches the exceptions, logs them,
and continues checking other nodes.

Change-Id: I343f722de8f79a50fbaa9fcdd180decdc5a43f95
Closes-Bug: #1262912

revisions:

protocols as well. They are defaulted to http and therefore the change is

commit_message:
Allow configuration of admin and internal protocols for keystone endpoint

The public address is already configurable (http or https). This change
introduces the possibility of also configuring admin and internal endpoint
protocols as well. They are defaulted to http and therefore the change is
non-breaking and backwards compatible.
There was also no existing spec tests for overriding the public protocol,
this is fixed in this commit.

Change-Id: I1baafa444636729c4b73d2cca0753f6348fbd2a0
(cherry picked from commit a5b5e1211fbee62d9587c34e5cea3190046c694f)

commit_message:
Don't slugify() None names

If image has no name, human_id can't be built.
Also slugify raises ValueError if None argument passed.
It affects Docker images.

Closes-Bug: #1267429
Closes-Bug: #1267130
Change-Id: Ib975775b441917eef2a650049cee9991d10c50d7

subject: Use template_format.parse for local stack parsing
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-01-12 21:33:42.000000000', 'files': ['heatclient/v1/shell.py'], 'message': 'Use template_format.parse for local stack parsing

Previously, API requests contained parsed templates for
json templates, but string content for YAML templates.

This change means that all requests will now contain parsed
templates. A parsed templates is required for get_file
client-side processing.

According to profiling that Clint performed, YAML parsing
could become a significant source of heat server load, so this
change will also mitigate this by pushing out YAML parsing
load to the clients.

This is part of a refactoring in preperation for
supporting the get_file intrinsic function.

Change-Id: Icca0f5e8ad197433872a995419648f841c9f82e0
'}]
commit_message:
Use template_format.parse for local stack parsing

Previously, API requests contained parsed templates for
json templates, but string content for YAML templates.

This change means that all requests will now contain parsed
templates. A parsed templates is required for get_file
client-side processing.

According to profiling that Clint performed, YAML parsing
could become a significant source of heat server load, so this
change will also mitigate this by pushing out YAML parsing
load to the clients.

This is part of a refactoring in preperation for
supporting the get_file intrinsic function.

Change-Id: Icca0f5e8ad197433872a995419648f841c9f82e0

subject: Cleanup test_no_admin_token_auth cleanup code
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-01-10 18:33:49.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/tests/test_no_admin_token_auth.py'], 'message': "Cleanup test_no_admin_token_auth cleanup code

The addCleanup call for the temporary paste config file was separated
from where it was needed because the function that required it
was outside the TestNoAdminTokenAuth class. This moves the
function to be a member and moves the addCleanup call in the
member function right where it's needed.

It's better to put the addCleanup code close to where it's needed
because then it will be called even if an exception occurs.

Change-Id: I50c97a3229958f4d15c7cd68ffa2a9d45914d1db
"}]
commit_message:
Cleanup test_no_admin_token_auth cleanup code

The addCleanup call for the temporary paste config file was separated
from where it was needed because the function that required it
was outside the TestNoAdminTokenAuth class. This moves the
function to be a member and moves the addCleanup call in the
member function right where it's needed.

It's better to put the addCleanup code close to where it's needed
because then it will be called even if an exception occurs.

Change-Id: I50c97a3229958f4d15c7cd68ffa2a9d45914d1db

commit_message:
Change xml and json files that contain only text to *.txt files

Otherwise, this book fails the new validation gates

Closes-Bug: #1270267

Change-Id: Ibbe16c8e4db64abb29c66c3b1a14cb90014d56a3
author: diane fleming
